00060 lst_sid_t LST_INVALID_SID = {LNET_NID_ANY, -1};
00061 static lst_sid_t           session_id;
00062 static int                 session_key;
00063 
00064 /* All nodes running 2.6.50 or later understand feature LST_FEAT_BULK_LEN */
00065 static unsigned         session_features = LST_FEATS_MASK;
00066 static lstcon_trans_stat_t      trans_stat;

00068 typedef struct list_string {
00069         struct list_string *lstr_next;
00070         int                 lstr_sz;
00071         char                lstr_str[0];
00072 } lstr_t;
00073 
00074 #ifndef offsetof
00075 # define offsetof(typ,memb)     ((unsigned long)((char *)&(((typ *)0)->memb)))
00076 #endif
00077 
00078 static int alloc_count = 0;
00079 static int alloc_nob   = 0;
00080 
00081 lstr_t *
00082 alloc_lstr(int sz)
00083 {
00084         lstr_t  *lstr = malloc(offsetof(lstr_t, lstr_str[sz]));
00085 
00086         if (lstr == NULL) {
00087                 fprintf(stderr, "Can't allocate lstr\n");
00088                 abort();
00089         }
00090 
00091         alloc_nob += sz;
00092         alloc_count++;
00093 
00094         lstr->lstr_str[0] = 0;
00095         lstr->lstr_sz = sz;
00096         return lstr;
00097 }
00098 
00099 void
00100 free_lstr(lstr_t *lstr)
00101 {
00102         alloc_count--;
00103         alloc_nob -= lstr->lstr_sz;
00104         free(lstr);
00105 }
00106 
00107 void
00108 free_lstrs(lstr_t **list)
00109 {
00110         lstr_t   *lstr;
00111 
00112         while ((lstr = *list) != NULL) {
00113                 *list = lstr->lstr_next;
00114                 free_lstr(lstr);
00115         }
00116 }
00117 
00118 void
00119 new_lstrs(lstr_t **list, char *prefix, char *postfix,
00120           int lo, int hi, int stride)
00121 {
00122         int    n1 = strlen(prefix);
00123         int    n2 = strlen(postfix);
00124         int    sz = n1 + 20 + n2 + 1;
00125 
00126         do {
00127                 lstr_t *n = alloc_lstr(sz);
00128 
00129                 snprintf(n->lstr_str, sz - 1, "%s%u%s",
00130                          prefix, lo, postfix);
00131 
00132                 n->lstr_next = *list;
00133                 *list = n;
00134 
00135                 lo += stride;
00136         } while (lo <= hi);
00137 }
00138 
00139 int
00140 expand_lstr(lstr_t **list, lstr_t *l)
00141 {
00142         int          nob = strlen(l->lstr_str);
00143         char        *b1;
00144         char        *b2;
00145         char        *expr;
00146         char        *sep;
00147         int          x;
00148         int          y;
00149         int          z;
00150         int          n;
00151 
00152         b1 = strchr(l->lstr_str, '[');
00153         if (b1 == NULL) {
00154                 l->lstr_next = *list;
00155                 *list = l;
00156                 return 0;
00157         }
00158 
00159         b2 = strchr(b1, ']');
00160         if (b2 == NULL || b2 == b1 + 1)
00161                 return -1;
00162 
00163         *b1++ = 0;
00164         *b2++ = 0;
00165         expr = b1;
00166         do {
00167 
00168                 sep = strchr(expr, ',');
00169                 if (sep != NULL)
00170                         *sep++ = 0;
00171 
00172                 nob = strlen(expr);
00173                 n = nob;
00174                 if (sscanf(expr, "%u%n", &x, &n) >= 1 && n == nob) {
00175                         /* simple number */
00176                         new_lstrs(list, l->lstr_str, b2, x, x, 1);
00177                         continue;
00178                 }
00179 
00180                 n = nob;
00181                 if (sscanf(expr, "%u-%u%n", &x, &y, &n) >= 2 && n == nob &&
00182                     x < y) {
00183                         /* simple range */
00184                         new_lstrs(list, l->lstr_str, b2, x, y, 1);
00185                         continue;
00186                 }
00187 
00188                 n = nob;
00189                 if (sscanf(expr, "%u-%u/%u%n", &x, &y, &z, &n) >= 3 && n == nob &&
00190                     x < y) {
00191                         /* strided range */
00192                         new_lstrs(list, l->lstr_str, b2, x, y, z);
00193                         continue;
00194                 }
00195 
00196                 /* syntax error */
00197                 return -1;
00198         } while ((expr = sep) != NULL);
00199 
00200         free_lstr(l);
00201 
00202         return 1;
00203 }
00204 
00205 int
00206 expand_strs(char *str, lstr_t **head)
00207 {
00208         lstr_t  *list = NULL;
00209         lstr_t  *nlist;
00210         lstr_t  *l;
00211         int      rc = 0;
00212         int      expanded;
00213 
00214         l = alloc_lstr(strlen(str) + 1);
00215         memcpy(l->lstr_str, str, strlen(str) + 1);
00216         l->lstr_next = NULL;
00217         list = l;
00218 
00219         do {
00220                 expanded = 0;
00221                 nlist = NULL;
00222 
00223                 while ((l = list) != NULL) {
00224                         list = l->lstr_next;
00225 
00226                         rc = expand_lstr(&nlist, l);
00227                         if (rc < 0) {
00228                                 fprintf(stderr, "Syntax error in \"%s\"\n", str);
00229                                 free_lstr(l);
00230                                 break;
00231                         }
00232 
00233                         expanded |= rc > 0;
00234                 }
00235 
00236                 /* re-order onto 'list' */
00237                 while ((l = nlist) != NULL) {
00238                         nlist = l->lstr_next;
00239                         l->lstr_next = list;
00240                         list = l;
00241                 }
00242 
00243         } while (expanded && rc > 0);
00244 
00245         if (rc >= 0) {
00246                 *head = list;
00247                 return 0;
00248         }
00249 
00250         while ((l = list) != NULL) {
00251                 list = l->lstr_next;
00252 
00253                 free_lstr(l);
00254         }
00255         return rc;
00256 }
00257 
00258 int
00259 lst_parse_nids(char *str, int *countp, lnet_process_id_t **idspp)
00260 {
00261         lstr_t  *head = NULL;
00262         lstr_t  *l;
00263         int      c = 0;
00264         int      i;
00265         int      rc;
00266 
00267         rc = expand_strs(str, &head);
00268         if (rc != 0)
00269                 goto out;
00270 
00271         l = head;
00272         while (l != NULL) {
00273                 l = l->lstr_next;
00274                 c++;
00275         }
00276 
00277         *idspp = malloc(c * sizeof(lnet_process_id_t));
00278         if (*idspp == NULL) {
00279                 fprintf(stderr, "Out of memory\n");
00280                 rc = -1;
00281         }
00282 
00283         *countp = c;
00284 out:
00285         i = 0;
00286         while ((l = head) != NULL) {
00287                 head = l->lstr_next;
00288 
00289                 if (rc == 0) {
00290                         (*idspp)[i].nid = libcfs_str2nid(l->lstr_str);
00291                         if ((*idspp)[i].nid == LNET_NID_ANY) {
00292                                 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid nid: %s\n",
00293                                         l->lstr_str);
00294                                 rc = -1;
00295                         }
00296 
00297                         (*idspp)[i].pid = LNET_PID_LUSTRE;
00298                         i++;
00299                 }
00300 
00301                 free_lstr(l);
00302         }
00303 
00304         if (rc == 0)
00305                 return 0;
00306 
00307         free(*idspp);
00308         *idspp = NULL;
00309 
00310         return rc;
00311 }

00313 char *
00314 lst_node_state2str(int state)
00315 {
00316         if (state == LST_NODE_ACTIVE)
00317                 return "Active";
00318         if (state == LST_NODE_BUSY)
00319                 return "Busy";
00320         if (state == LST_NODE_DOWN)
00321                 return "Down";
00322 
00323         return "Unknown";
00324 }
00325 
00326 int
00327 lst_node_str2state(char *str)
00328 {
00329         if (strcasecmp(str, "active") == 0)
00330                 return LST_NODE_ACTIVE;
00331         if (strcasecmp(str, "busy") == 0)
00332                 return LST_NODE_BUSY;
00333         if (strcasecmp(str, "down") == 0)
00334                 return LST_NODE_DOWN;
00335         if (strcasecmp(str, "unknown") == 0)
00336                 return LST_NODE_UNKNOWN;
00337         if (strcasecmp(str, "invalid") == 0)
00338                 return (LST_NODE_UNKNOWN | LST_NODE_DOWN | LST_NODE_BUSY);
00339 
00340         return -1;
00341 }

00343 char *
00344 lst_test_type2name(int type)
00345 {
00346         if (type == LST_TEST_PING)
00347                 return "ping";
00348         if (type == LST_TEST_BULK)
00349                 return "brw";
00350 
00351         return "unknown";
00352 }
00353 
00354 int
00355 lst_test_name2type(char *name)
00356 {
00357         if (strcasecmp(name, "ping") == 0)
00358                 return LST_TEST_PING;
00359         if (strcasecmp(name, "brw") == 0)
00360                 return LST_TEST_BULK;
00361 
00362         return -1;
00363 }

00365 void
00366 lst_print_usage(char *cmd)
00367 {
00368         Parser_printhelp(cmd);
00369 }
00370 
00371 void
00372 lst_print_error(char *sub, const char *def_format, ...)
00373 {
00374         va_list ap;
00375 
00376         /* local error returned from kernel */
00377         switch (errno) {
00378         case ESRCH:
00379                 fprintf(stderr, "No session exists\n");
00380                 return;
00381         case ESHUTDOWN:
00382                 fprintf(stderr, "Session is shutting down\n");
00383                 return;
00384         case EACCES:
00385                 fprintf(stderr, "Unmatched session key or not root\n");
00386                 return;
00387         case ENOENT:
00388                 fprintf(stderr, "Can't find %s in current session\n", sub);
00389                 return;
00390         case EINVAL:
00391                 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid parameters list in command line\n");
00392                 return;
00393         case EFAULT:
00394                 fprintf(stderr, "Bad parameter address\n");
00395                 return;
00396         case EEXIST:
00397                 fprintf(stderr, "%s already exists\n", sub);
00398                 return;
00399         default:
00400                 va_start(ap, def_format);
00401                 vfprintf(stderr, def_format, ap);
00402                 va_end(ap);
00403 
00404                 return;
00405         }
00406 }
00407 
00408 void
00409 lst_free_rpcent(struct list_head *head)
00410 {
00411         lstcon_rpc_ent_t *ent;
00412 
00413         while (!list_empty(head)) {
00414                 ent = list_entry(head->next, lstcon_rpc_ent_t, rpe_link);
00415 
00416                 list_del(&ent->rpe_link);
00417                 free(ent);
00418         }
00419 }
00420 
00421 void
00422 lst_reset_rpcent(struct list_head *head)
00423 {
00424         lstcon_rpc_ent_t *ent;
00425 
00426         list_for_each_entry(ent, head, rpe_link) {
00427                 ent->rpe_sid       = LST_INVALID_SID;
00428                 ent->rpe_peer.nid  = LNET_NID_ANY;
00429                 ent->rpe_peer.pid  = LNET_PID_ANY;
00430                 ent->rpe_rpc_errno = ent->rpe_fwk_errno = 0;
00431         }
00432 }
00433 
00434 int
00435 lst_alloc_rpcent(struct list_head *head, int count, int offset)
00436 {
00437         lstcon_rpc_ent_t *ent;
00438         int               i;
00439 
00440         for (i = 0; i < count; i++) {
00441                 ent = malloc(offsetof(lstcon_rpc_ent_t, rpe_payload[offset]));
00442                 if (ent == NULL) {
00443                         lst_free_rpcent(head);
00444                         return -1;
00445                 }
00446 
00447                 memset(ent, 0, offsetof(lstcon_rpc_ent_t, rpe_payload[offset]));
00448 
00449                 ent->rpe_sid      = LST_INVALID_SID;
00450                 ent->rpe_peer.nid = LNET_NID_ANY;
00451                 ent->rpe_peer.pid = LNET_PID_ANY;
00452                 list_add(&ent->rpe_link, head);
00453         }
00454 
00455         return 0;
00456 }
00457 
00458 void
00459 lst_print_transerr(struct list_head *head, char *optstr)
00460 {
00461         lstcon_rpc_ent_t *ent;
00462 
00463         list_for_each_entry(ent, head, rpe_link) {
00464                 if (ent->rpe_rpc_errno == 0 && ent->rpe_fwk_errno == 0)
00465                         continue;
00466 
00467                 if (ent->rpe_rpc_errno != 0) {
00468                         fprintf(stderr, "%s RPC failed on %s: %s\n",
00469                                 optstr, libcfs_id2str(ent->rpe_peer),
00470                                 strerror(ent->rpe_rpc_errno));
00471                         continue;
00472                 }
00473 
00474                 fprintf(stderr, "operation %s failed on %s: %s\n",
00475                         optstr, libcfs_id2str(ent->rpe_peer),
00476                         strerror(ent->rpe_fwk_errno));
00477         }
00478 }

00489 
00490 int
00491 lst_ioctl(unsigned int opc, void *buf, int len)
00492 {
00493         struct libcfs_ioctl_data data;
00494         int    rc;
00495 
00496         LIBCFS_IOC_INIT (data);
00497         data.ioc_u32[0]  = opc;
00498         data.ioc_plen1   = len;
00499         data.ioc_pbuf1   = (char *)buf;
00500         data.ioc_plen2   = sizeof(trans_stat);
00501         data.ioc_pbuf2   = (char *)&trans_stat;
00502 
00503         memset(&trans_stat, 0, sizeof(trans_stat));
00504 
00505         rc = l_ioctl(LNET_DEV_ID, IOC_LIBCFS_LNETST, &data);
00506 
00507         /* local error, no valid RPC result */
00508         if (rc != 0)
00509                 return -1;
00510 
00511         /* RPC error */
00512         if (trans_stat.trs_rpc_errno != 0)
00513                 return -2;
00514 
00515         /* Framework error */
00516         if (trans_stat.trs_fwk_errno != 0)
00517                 return -3;
00518 
00519         return 0;
00520 }
00521 
00522 int
00523 lst_new_session_ioctl(char *name, int timeout, int force, lst_sid_t *sid)
00524 {
00525         lstio_session_new_args_t args = {0};
00526 
00527         args.lstio_ses_key     = session_key;
00528         args.lstio_ses_timeout = timeout;
00529         args.lstio_ses_force   = force;
00530         args.lstio_ses_idp     = sid;
00531         args.lstio_ses_feats   = session_features;
00532         args.lstio_ses_nmlen   = strlen(name);
00533         args.lstio_ses_namep   = name;
00534 
00535         return lst_ioctl (LSTIO_SESSION_NEW, &args, sizeof(args));
00536 }
00537 
00538 int
00539 jt_lst_new_session(int argc,  char **argv)
00540 {
00541         char  buf[LST_NAME_SIZE];
00542         char *name;
00543         int   optidx  = 0;
00544         int   timeout = 300;
00545         int   force   = 0;
00546         int   c;
00547         int   rc;
00548 
00549         static struct option session_opts[] =
00550         {
00551                 {"timeout", required_argument,  0, 't' },
00552                 {"force",   no_argument,        0, 'f' },
00553                 {0,         0,                  0,  0  }
00554         };
00555 
00556         if (session_key == 0) {
00557                 fprintf(stderr,
00558                         "Can't find env LST_SESSION or value is not valid\n");
00559                 return -1;
00560         }
00561 
00562         while (1) {
00563 
00564                 c = getopt_long(argc, argv, "ft:",
00565                                 session_opts, &optidx);
00566 
00567                 if (c == -1)
00568                         break;
00569 
00570                 switch (c) {
00571                 case 'f':
00572                         force = 1;
00573                         break;
00574                 case 't':
00575                         timeout = atoi(optarg);
00576                         break;
00577                 default:
00578                         lst_print_usage(argv[0]);
00579                         return -1;
00580                 }
00581         }
00582 
00583         if (timeout <= 0) {
00584                 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid timeout value\n");
00585                 return -1;
00586         }
00587 
00588         if (optind == argc - 1) {
00589                 name = argv[optind ++];
00590                 if (strlen(name) >= LST_NAME_SIZE) {
00591                         fprintf(stderr, "Name size is limited to %d\n",
00592                                 LST_NAME_SIZE - 1);
00593                         return -1;
00594                 }
00595 
00596         } else if (optind == argc) {
00597                 char           user[LST_NAME_SIZE];
00598                 char           host[LST_NAME_SIZE];
00599                 struct passwd *pw = getpwuid(getuid());
00600 
00601                 if (pw == NULL)
00602                         snprintf(user, sizeof(user), "%d", (int)getuid());
00603                 else
00604                         snprintf(user, sizeof(user), "%s", pw->pw_name);
00605 
00606                 rc = gethostname(host, sizeof(host));
00607                 if (rc != 0)
00608                         snprintf(host, sizeof(host), "unknown_host");
00609 
00610                 snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "%s@%s", user, host);
00611                 name = buf;
00612 
00613         } else {
00614                 lst_print_usage(argv[0]);
00615                 return -1;
00616         }
00617 
00618         rc = lst_new_session_ioctl(name, timeout, force, &session_id);
00619         if (rc != 0) {
00620                 lst_print_error("session", "Failed to create session: %s\n",
00621                                 strerror(errno));
00622                 return rc;
00623         }
00624 
00625         fprintf(stdout, "SESSION: %s FEATURES: %x TIMEOUT: %d FORCE: %s\n",
00626                 name, session_features, timeout, force ? "Yes" : "No");
00627         return 0;
00628 }

00630 int
00631 lst_session_info_ioctl(char *name, int len, int *key, unsigned *featp,
00632                        lst_sid_t *sid, lstcon_ndlist_ent_t *ndinfo)
00633 {
00634         lstio_session_info_args_t args = {0};

00636         args.lstio_ses_idp     = sid;
00637         args.lstio_ses_keyp    = key;
00638         args.lstio_ses_featp   = featp;
00639         args.lstio_ses_ndinfo  = ndinfo;
00640         args.lstio_ses_nmlen   = len;
00641         args.lstio_ses_namep   = name;
00642 
00643         return lst_ioctl(LSTIO_SESSION_INFO, &args, sizeof(args));
00644 }

00646 int
00647 jt_lst_show_session(int argc, char **argv)
00648 {
00649         lstcon_ndlist_ent_t ndinfo;
00650         lst_sid_t           sid;
00651         char                name[LST_NAME_SIZE];
00652         unsigned            feats;
00653         int                 key;
00654         int                 rc;
00655 
00656         rc = lst_session_info_ioctl(name, sizeof(name), &key,
00657                                     &feats, &sid, &ndinfo);
00658 
00659         if (rc != 0) {
00660                 lst_print_error("session", "Failed to show session: %s\n",
00661                                 strerror(errno));
00662                 return -1;
00663         }
00664 
00665         fprintf(stdout, "%s ID: %ju@%s, KEY: %d FEATURES: %x NODES: %d\n",
00666                 name, (uintmax_t)sid.ses_stamp, libcfs_nid2str(sid.ses_nid),
00667                 key, feats, ndinfo.nle_nnode);
00668 
00669         return 0;
00670 }
00671 
00672 int
00673 lst_end_session_ioctl(void)
00674 {
00675         lstio_session_end_args_t args = {0};
00676 
00677         args.lstio_ses_key =  session_key;
00678         return lst_ioctl (LSTIO_SESSION_END, &args, sizeof(args));
00679 }
00680 
00681 int
00682 jt_lst_end_session(int argc, char **argv)
00683 {
00684         int             rc;
00685 
00686         if (session_key == 0) {
00687                 fprintf(stderr,
00688                         "Can't find env LST_SESSION or value is not valid\n");
00689                 return -1;
00690         }
00691 
00692         rc = lst_end_session_ioctl();
00693 
00694         if (rc == 0) {
00695                 fprintf(stdout, "session is ended\n");
00696                 return 0;
00697         }
00698 
00699         if (rc == -1) {
00700                 lst_print_error("session", "Failed to end session: %s\n",
00701                                 strerror(errno));
00702                 return rc;
00703         }
00704 
00705         if (trans_stat.trs_rpc_errno != 0) {
00706                 fprintf(stderr,
00707                         "[RPC] Failed to send %d session RPCs: %s\n",
00708                         lstcon_rpc_stat_failure(&trans_stat, 0),
00709                         strerror(trans_stat.trs_rpc_errno));
00710         }
00711 
00712         if (trans_stat.trs_fwk_errno != 0) {
00713                 fprintf(stderr,
00714                         "[FWK] Failed to end session on %d nodes: %s\n",
00715                         lstcon_sesop_stat_failure(&trans_stat, 0),
00716                         strerror(trans_stat.trs_fwk_errno));
00717         }
00718 
00719         return rc;
00720 }
00721 
00722 int
00723 lst_ping_ioctl(char *str, int type, int timeout,
00724                int count, lnet_process_id_t *ids, struct list_head *head)
00725 {
00726         lstio_debug_args_t args = {0};
00727 
00728         args.lstio_dbg_key     = session_key;
00729         args.lstio_dbg_type    = type;
00730         args.lstio_dbg_flags   = 0;
00731         args.lstio_dbg_timeout = timeout;
00732         args.lstio_dbg_nmlen   = (str == NULL) ? 0: strlen(str);
00733         args.lstio_dbg_namep   = str;
00734         args.lstio_dbg_count   = count;
00735         args.lstio_dbg_idsp    = ids;
00736         args.lstio_dbg_resultp = head;
00737 
00738         return lst_ioctl (LSTIO_DEBUG, &args, sizeof(args));
00739 }
00740 
00741 int
00742 lst_get_node_count(int type, char *str, int *countp, lnet_process_id_t **idspp)
00743 {
00744         char                    buf[LST_NAME_SIZE];
00745         lstcon_test_batch_ent_t ent;
00746         lstcon_ndlist_ent_t    *entp = &ent.tbe_cli_nle;
00747         lst_sid_t               sid;
00748         unsigned                feats;
00749         int                     key;
00750         int                     rc;
00751 
00752         switch (type) {
00753         case LST_OPC_SESSION:
00754                 rc = lst_session_info_ioctl(buf, LST_NAME_SIZE,
00755                                             &key, &feats, &sid, entp);
00756                 break;
00757 
00758         case LST_OPC_BATCHSRV:
00759                 entp = &ent.tbe_srv_nle;
00760         case LST_OPC_BATCHCLI:
00761                 rc = lst_info_batch_ioctl(str, 0, 0, &ent, NULL, NULL, NULL);
00762                 break;
00763 
00764         case LST_OPC_GROUP:
00765                 rc = lst_info_group_ioctl(str, entp, NULL, NULL, NULL);
00766                 break;
00767 
00768         case LST_OPC_NODES:
00769                 rc = lst_parse_nids(str, &entp->nle_nnode, idspp) < 0 ? -1 : 0;
00770                 break;
00771 
00772         default:
00773                 rc = -1;
00774                 break;
00775         }
00776 
00777         if (rc == 0)
00778                 *countp = entp->nle_nnode;
00779 
00780         return rc;
00781 }
00782 
00783 int
00784 jt_lst_ping(int argc,  char **argv)
00785 {
00786         struct list_head   head;
00787         lnet_process_id_t *ids = NULL;
00788         lstcon_rpc_ent_t  *ent = NULL;
00789         char              *str = NULL;
00790         int                optidx  = 0;
00791         int                server  = 0;
00792         int                timeout = 5;
00793         int                count   = 0;
00794         int                type    = 0;
00795         int                rc      = 0;
00796         int                c;
00797 
00798         static struct option ping_opts[] =
00799         {
00800                 {"session", no_argument,       0, 's' },
00801                 {"server",  no_argument,       0, 'v' },
00802                 {"batch",   required_argument, 0, 'b' },
00803                 {"group",   required_argument, 0, 'g' },
00804                 {"nodes",   required_argument, 0, 'n' },
00805                 {"timeout", required_argument, 0, 't' },
00806                 {0,         0,                 0,  0  }
00807         };
00808 
00809         if (session_key == 0) {
00810                 fprintf(stderr,
00811                         "Can't find env LST_SESSION or value is not valid\n");
00812                 return -1;
00813         }
00814 
00815         while (1) {
00816 
00817                 c = getopt_long(argc, argv, "g:b:n:t:sv",
00818                                 ping_opts, &optidx);
00819 
00820                 if (c == -1)
00821                         break;
00822 
00823                 switch (c) {
00824                 case 's':
00825                         type = LST_OPC_SESSION;
00826                         break;
00827 
00828                 case 'g':
00829                         type = LST_OPC_GROUP;
00830                         str = optarg;
00831                         break;
00832 
00833                 case 'b':
00834                         type = LST_OPC_BATCHCLI;
00835                         str = optarg;
00836                         break;
00837 
00838                 case 'n':
00839                         type = LST_OPC_NODES;
00840                         str = optarg;
00841                         break;
00842 
00843                 case 't':
00844                         timeout = atoi(optarg);
00845                         break;
00846 
00847                 case 'v':
00848                         server = 1;
00849                         break;
00850 
00851                 default:
00852                         lst_print_usage(argv[0]);
00853                         return -1;
00854                 }
00855         }
00856 
00857         if (type == 0 || timeout <= 0 || optind != argc) {
00858                 lst_print_usage(argv[0]);
00859                 return -1;
00860         }
00861 
00862         if (type == LST_OPC_BATCHCLI && server)
00863                 type = LST_OPC_BATCHSRV;
00864 
00865         rc = lst_get_node_count(type, str, &count, &ids);
00866         if (rc < 0) {
00867                 fprintf(stderr, "Failed to get count of nodes from %s: %s\n",
00868                         (str == NULL) ? "session" : str, strerror(errno));
00869                 return -1;
00870         }
00871 
00872         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&head);
00873 
00874         rc = lst_alloc_rpcent(&head, count, LST_NAME_SIZE);
00875         if (rc != 0) {
00876                 fprintf(stderr, "Out of memory\n");
00877                 goto out;
00878         }
00879 
00880         if (count == 0) {
00881                 fprintf(stdout, "Target %s is empty\n",
00882                         (str == NULL) ? "session" : str);
00883                 goto out;
00884         }
00885 
00886         rc = lst_ping_ioctl(str, type, timeout, count, ids, &head);
00887         if (rc == -1) { /* local failure */
00888                 lst_print_error("debug", "Failed to ping %s: %s\n",
00889                                 (str == NULL) ? "session" : str,
00890                                 strerror(errno));
00891                 rc = -1;
00892                 goto out;
00893         }
00894 
00895         /* ignore RPC errors and framwork errors */
00896         list_for_each_entry(ent, &head, rpe_link) {
00897                 fprintf(stdout, "\t%s: %s [session: %s id: %s]\n",
00898                         libcfs_id2str(ent->rpe_peer),
00899                         lst_node_state2str(ent->rpe_state),
00900                         (ent->rpe_state == LST_NODE_ACTIVE ||
00901                          ent->rpe_state == LST_NODE_BUSY) ?
00902                                 (ent->rpe_rpc_errno == 0 ?
00903                                         &ent->rpe_payload[0] : "Unknown") :
00904                                 "<NULL>", libcfs_nid2str(ent->rpe_sid.ses_nid));
00905         }
00906 
00907 out:
00908         lst_free_rpcent(&head);
00909 
00910         if (ids != NULL)
00911                 free(ids);
00912 
00913         return rc;
00914 
00915 }
00916 
00917 int
00918 lst_add_nodes_ioctl (char *name, int count, lnet_process_id_t *ids,
00919                      unsigned *featp, struct list_head *resultp)
00920 {
00921         lstio_group_nodes_args_t args = {0};
00922 
00923         args.lstio_grp_key     = session_key;
00924         args.lstio_grp_nmlen   = strlen(name);
00925         args.lstio_grp_namep   = name;
00926         args.lstio_grp_count   = count;
00927         args.lstio_grp_featp   = featp;
00928         args.lstio_grp_idsp    = ids;
00929         args.lstio_grp_resultp = resultp;
00930 
00931         return lst_ioctl(LSTIO_NODES_ADD, &args, sizeof(args));
00932 }
00933 
00934 int
00935 lst_del_group_ioctl(char *name)
00936 {
00937         lstio_group_del_args_t args = {0};
00938 
00939         args.lstio_grp_key   = session_key;
00940         args.lstio_grp_nmlen = strlen(name);
00941         args.lstio_grp_namep = name;
00942 
00943         return lst_ioctl(LSTIO_GROUP_DEL, &args, sizeof(args));
00944 }
00945 
00946 int
00947 lst_del_group(char *grp_name)
00948 {
00949         int     rc;
00950 
00951         rc = lst_del_group_ioctl(grp_name);
00952         if (rc == 0) {
00953                 fprintf(stdout, "Group is deleted\n");
00954                 return 0;
00955         }
00956 
00957         if (rc == -1) {
00958                 lst_print_error("group", "Failed to delete group: %s\n",
00959                                 strerror(errno));
00960                 return rc;
00961         }
00962 
00963         fprintf(stderr, "Group is deleted with some errors\n");
00964 
00965         if (trans_stat.trs_rpc_errno != 0) {
00966                 fprintf(stderr,
00967                         "[RPC] Failed to send %d end session RPCs: %s\n",
00968                         lstcon_rpc_stat_failure(&trans_stat, 0),
00969                         strerror(trans_stat.trs_rpc_errno));
00970         }
00971 
00972         if (trans_stat.trs_fwk_errno != 0) {
00973                 fprintf(stderr,
00974                         "[FWK] Failed to end session on %d nodes: %s\n",
00975                 lstcon_sesop_stat_failure(&trans_stat, 0),
00976                 strerror(trans_stat.trs_fwk_errno));
00977         }
00978 
00979         return -1;
00980 }
00981 
00982 int
00983 lst_add_group_ioctl (char *name)
00984 {
00985         lstio_group_add_args_t args = {0};
00986 
00987         args.lstio_grp_key     =  session_key;
00988         args.lstio_grp_nmlen   =  strlen(name);
00989         args.lstio_grp_namep   =  name;
00990 
00991         return lst_ioctl(LSTIO_GROUP_ADD, &args, sizeof(args));
00992 }
00993 
00994 int
00995 jt_lst_add_group(int argc, char **argv)
00996 {
00997         struct list_head   head;
00998         lnet_process_id_t *ids;
00999         char              *name;
01000         unsigned           feats = session_features;
01001         int                count;
01002         int                rc;
01003         int                i;
01004         bool               nodes_added = false;
01005 
01006         if (session_key == 0) {
01007                 fprintf(stderr,
01008                         "Can't find env LST_SESSION or value is not valid\n");
01009                 return -1;
01010         }
01011 
01012         if (argc < 3) {
01013                 lst_print_usage(argv[0]);
01014                 return -1;
01015         }
01016 
01017         name = argv[1];
01018         if (strlen(name) >= LST_NAME_SIZE) {
01019                 fprintf(stderr, "Name length is limited to %d\n",
01020                         LST_NAME_SIZE - 1);
01021                 return -1;
01022         }
01023 
01024         rc = lst_add_group_ioctl(name);
01025         if (rc != 0) {
01026                 lst_print_error("group", "Failed to add group %s: %s\n",
01027                                 name, strerror(errno));
01028                 return -1;
01029         }
01030 
01031         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&head);
01032 
01033         for (i = 2; i < argc; i++) {
01034                 /* parse address list */
01035                 rc = lst_parse_nids(argv[i], &count, &ids);
01036                 if (rc < 0) {
01037                         fprintf(stderr, "Ignore invalid id list %s\n",
01038                                 argv[i]);
01039                         continue;
01040                 }
01041 
01042                 if (count == 0)
01043                         continue;
01044 
01045                 rc = lst_alloc_rpcent(&head, count, 0);
01046                 if (rc != 0) {
01047                         fprintf(stderr, "Out of memory\n");
01048                         free(ids);
01049                         rc = -1;
01050                         goto failed;
01051                 }
01052 
01053                 rc = lst_add_nodes_ioctl(name, count, ids, &feats, &head);
01054 
01055                 free(ids);
01056 
01057                 if (rc != 0)
01058                         goto failed;
01059 
01060                 fprintf(stdout, "%s are added to session\n", argv[i]);
01061 
01062                 nodes_added = true;
01063 
01064                 if ((feats & session_features) != session_features) {
01065                         fprintf(stdout,
01066                                 "Warning, this session will run with "
01067                                 "compatible mode because some test nodes "
01068                                 "might not understand these features: %x\n",
01069                                 (~feats & session_features));
01070                 }
01071 
01072                 lst_free_rpcent(&head);
01073         }
01074 
01075         if (!nodes_added) {
01076                 /*
01077                  * The selftest kernel module expects that a group should
01078                  * have at least one node, since it doesn't make sense for
01079                  * an empty group to be added to a test.
01080                  */
01081                 fprintf(stderr,
01082                         "No nodes added successfully, deleting group %s\n",
01083                         name);
01084                 rc = lst_del_group(name);
01085                 if (rc != 0) {
01086                         fprintf(stderr,
01087                                 "Failed to delete group %s."
01088                                 "  Group is empty.\n", name);
01089                 }
01090         }
01091 
01092         return rc;
01093 
01094 failed:
01095         if (rc == -1) {
01096                 lst_print_error("group", "Failed to add nodes %s: %s\n",
01097                                 argv[i], strerror(errno));
01098 
01099         } else {
01100                 if (trans_stat.trs_fwk_errno == EPROTO) {
01101                         fprintf(stderr,
01102                                 "test nodes might have different LST "
01103                                 "features, please disable some features by "
01104                                 "setting LST_FEATURES\n");
01105                 }
01106 
01107                 lst_print_transerr(&head, "create session");
01108         }
01109 
01110         lst_free_rpcent(&head);
01111 
01112         if (!nodes_added) {
01113                 fprintf(stderr,
01114                         "No nodes added successfully, deleting group %s\n",
01115                         name);
01116                 if (lst_del_group(name) != 0) {
01117                         fprintf(stderr,
01118                                 "Failed to delete group %s."
01119                                 "  Group is empty.\n", name);
01120                 }
01121         }
01122 
01123         return rc;
01124 }
01125 
01126 int
01127 jt_lst_del_group(int argc, char **argv)
01128 {
01129         int     rc;
01130 
01131         if (session_key == 0) {
01132                 fprintf(stderr,
01133                         "Can't find env LST_SESSION or value is not valid\n");
01134                 return -1;
01135         }
01136 
01137         if (argc != 2) {
01138                 lst_print_usage(argv[0]);
01139                 return -1;
01140         }
01141 
01142         rc = lst_del_group(argv[1]);
01143 
01144         return rc;
01145 }
01146 
01147 int
01148 lst_update_group_ioctl(int opc, char *name, int clean, int count,
01149                        lnet_process_id_t *ids, struct list_head *resultp)
01150 {
01151         lstio_group_update_args_t args = {0};
01152 
01153         args.lstio_grp_key      = session_key;
01154         args.lstio_grp_opc      = opc;
01155         args.lstio_grp_args     = clean;
01156         args.lstio_grp_nmlen    = strlen(name);
01157         args.lstio_grp_namep    = name;
01158         args.lstio_grp_count    = count;
01159         args.lstio_grp_idsp     = ids;
01160         args.lstio_grp_resultp  = resultp;
01161 
01162         return lst_ioctl(LSTIO_GROUP_UPDATE, &args, sizeof(args));
01163 }
01164 
01165 int
01166 jt_lst_update_group(int argc, char **argv)
01167 {
01168         struct list_head         head;
01169         lnet_process_id_t *ids = NULL;
01170         char              *str = NULL;
01171         char              *grp = NULL;
01172         int                optidx = 0;
01173         int                count = 0;
01174         int                clean = 0;
01175         int                opc = 0;
01176         int                rc;
01177         int                c;
01178 
01179         static struct option update_group_opts[] =
01180         {
01181                 {"refresh", no_argument,       0, 'f' },
01182                 {"clean",   required_argument, 0, 'c' },
01183                 {"remove",  required_argument, 0, 'r' },
01184                 {0,         0,                 0,  0  }
01185         };
01186 
01187         if (session_key == 0) {
01188                 fprintf(stderr,
01189                         "Can't find env LST_SESSION or value is not valid\n");
01190                 return -1;
01191         }
01192 
01193         while (1) {
01194                 c = getopt_long(argc, argv, "fc:r:",
01195                                 update_group_opts, &optidx);
01196 
01197                 /* Detect the end of the options. */
01198                 if (c == -1)
01199                         break;
01200 
01201                 switch (c) {
01202                 case 'f':
01203                         if (opc != 0) {
01204                                 lst_print_usage(argv[0]);
01205                                 return -1;
01206                         }
01207                         opc = LST_GROUP_REFRESH;
01208                         break;
01209 
01210                 case 'r':
01211                         if (opc != 0) {
01212                                 lst_print_usage(argv[0]);
01213                                 return -1;
01214                         }
01215                         opc = LST_GROUP_RMND;
01216                         str = optarg;
01217                         break;
01218 
01219                 case 'c':
01220                         clean = lst_node_str2state(optarg);
01221                         if (opc != 0 || clean <= 0) {
01222                                 lst_print_usage(argv[0]);
01223                                 return -1;
01224                         }
01225                         opc = LST_GROUP_CLEAN;
01226                         break;
01227 
01228                 default:
01229                         lst_print_usage(argv[0]);
01230                         return -1;
01231                 }
01232         }
01233 
01234         /* no OPC or group is specified */
01235         if (opc == 0 || optind != argc - 1) {
01236                 lst_print_usage(argv[0]);
01237                 return -1;
01238         }
01239 
01240         grp = argv[optind];
01241 
01242         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&head);
01243 
01244         if (opc == LST_GROUP_RMND || opc == LST_GROUP_REFRESH) {
01245                 rc = lst_get_node_count(opc == LST_GROUP_RMND ? LST_OPC_NODES :
01246                                                                 LST_OPC_GROUP,
01247                                         opc == LST_GROUP_RMND ? str : grp,
01248                                         &count, &ids);
01249 
01250                 if (rc != 0) {
01251                         fprintf(stderr, "Can't get count of nodes from %s: %s\n",
01252                                 opc == LST_GROUP_RMND ? str : grp,
01253                                 strerror(errno));
01254                         return -1;
01255                 }
01256 
01257                 rc = lst_alloc_rpcent(&head, count, 0);
01258                 if (rc != 0) {
01259                         fprintf(stderr, "Out of memory\n");
01260                         free(ids);
01261                         return -1;
01262                 }
01263 
01264         }
01265 
01266         rc = lst_update_group_ioctl(opc, grp, clean, count, ids, &head);
01267 
01268         if (ids != NULL)
01269                 free(ids);
01270 
01271         if (rc == 0) {
01272                 lst_free_rpcent(&head);
01273                 return 0;
01274         }
01275 
01276         if (rc == -1) {
01277                 lst_free_rpcent(&head);
01278                 lst_print_error("group", "Failed to update group: %s\n",
01279                                 strerror(errno));
01280                 return rc;
01281         }
01282 
01283         lst_print_transerr(&head, "Updating group");
01284 
01285         lst_free_rpcent(&head);
01286 
01287         return rc;
01288 }
01289 
01290 int
01291 lst_list_group_ioctl(int len, char *name, int idx)
01292 {
01293         lstio_group_list_args_t args = {0};
01294 
01295         args.lstio_grp_key   = session_key;
01296         args.lstio_grp_idx   = idx;
01297         args.lstio_grp_nmlen = len;
01298         args.lstio_grp_namep = name;
01299 
01300         return lst_ioctl(LSTIO_GROUP_LIST, &args, sizeof(args));
01301 }
01302 
01303 int
01304 lst_info_group_ioctl(char *name, lstcon_ndlist_ent_t *gent,
01305                      int *idx, int *count, lstcon_node_ent_t *dents)
01306 {
01307         lstio_group_info_args_t args = {0};
01308 
01309         args.lstio_grp_key    = session_key;
01310         args.lstio_grp_nmlen  = strlen(name);
01311         args.lstio_grp_namep  = name;
01312         args.lstio_grp_entp   = gent;
01313         args.lstio_grp_idxp   = idx;
01314         args.lstio_grp_ndentp = count;
01315         args.lstio_grp_dentsp = dents;
01316
