01318 }
01319 
01320 int
01321 lst_list_group_all(void)
01322 {
01323         char  name[LST_NAME_SIZE];
01324         int   rc;
01325         int   i;
01326 
01327         /* no group is specified, list name of all groups */
01328         for (i = 0; ; i++) {
01329                 rc = lst_list_group_ioctl(LST_NAME_SIZE, name, i);
01330                 if (rc == 0) {
01331                         fprintf(stdout, "%d) %s\n", i + 1, name);
01332                         continue;
01333                 }
01334 
01335                 if (errno == ENOENT)
01336                         break;
01337 
01338                 lst_print_error("group", "Failed to list group: %s\n",
01339                                 strerror(errno));
01340                 return -1;
01341         }
01342 
01343         fprintf(stdout, "Total %d groups\n", i);
01344 
01345         return 0;
01346 }
01347 
01348 #define LST_NODES_TITLE "\tACTIVE\tBUSY\tDOWN\tUNKNOWN\tTOTAL\n"
01349 
01350 int
01351 jt_lst_list_group(int argc, char **argv)
01352 {
01353         lstcon_ndlist_ent_t  gent;
01354         lstcon_node_ent_t   *dents;
01355         int               optidx  = 0;
01356         int               verbose = 0;
01357         int               active  = 0;
01358         int               busy    = 0;
01359         int               down    = 0;
01360         int               unknown = 0;
01361         int               all     = 0;
01362         int               count;
01363         int               index;
01364         int               i;
01365         int               j;
01366         int               c;
01367         int               rc = 0;
01368 
01369         static struct option list_group_opts[] =
01370         {
01371                 {"active",  no_argument, 0, 'a' },
01372                 {"busy",    no_argument, 0, 'b' },
01373                 {"down",    no_argument, 0, 'd' },
01374                 {"unknown", no_argument, 0, 'u' },
01375                 {"all",     no_argument, 0, 'l' },
01376                 {0,         0,           0,  0  }
01377         };
01378 
01379         if (session_key == 0) {
01380                 fprintf(stderr,
01381                         "Can't find env LST_SESSION or value is not valid\n");
01382                 return -1;
01383         }
01384 
01385         while (1) {
01386                 c = getopt_long(argc, argv, "abdul",
01387                                 list_group_opts, &optidx);
01388 
01389                 if (c == -1)
01390                         break;
01391 
01392                 switch (c) {
01393                 case 'a':
01394                         verbose = active = 1;
01395                         all = 0;
01396                         break;
01397                 case 'b':
01398                         verbose = busy = 1;
01399                         all = 0;
01400                         break;
01401                 case 'd':
01402                         verbose = down = 1;
01403                         all = 0;
01404                         break;
01405                 case 'u':
01406                         verbose = unknown = 1;
01407                         all = 0;
01408                         break;
01409                 case 'l':
01410                         verbose = all = 1;
01411                         break;
01412                 default:
01413                         lst_print_usage(argv[0]);
01414                         return -1;
01415                 }
01416         }
01417 
01418         if (optind == argc) {
01419                 /* no group is specified, list name of all groups */
01420                 rc = lst_list_group_all();
01421 
01422                 return rc;
01423         }
01424 
01425         if (!verbose)
01426                 fprintf(stdout, LST_NODES_TITLE);
01427 
01428         /* list nodes in specified groups */
01429         for (i = optind; i < argc; i++) {
01430                 rc = lst_info_group_ioctl(argv[i], &gent, NULL, NULL, NULL);
01431                 if (rc != 0) {
01432                         if (errno == ENOENT) {
01433                                 rc = 0;
01434                                 break;
01435                         }
01436 
01437                         lst_print_error("group", "Failed to list group\n",
01438                                         strerror(errno));
01439                         break;
01440                 }
01441 
01442                 if (!verbose) {
01443                         fprintf(stdout, "\t%d\t%d\t%d\t%d\t%d\t%s\n",
01444                                 gent.nle_nactive, gent.nle_nbusy,
01445                                 gent.nle_ndown, gent.nle_nunknown,
01446                                 gent.nle_nnode, argv[i]);
01447                         continue;
01448                 }
01449 
01450                 fprintf(stdout, "Group [ %s ]\n", argv[i]);
01451 
01452                 if (gent.nle_nnode == 0) {
01453                         fprintf(stdout, "No nodes found [ %s ]\n", argv[i]);
01454                         continue;
01455                 }
01456 
01457                 count = gent.nle_nnode;
01458 
01459                 dents = malloc(count * sizeof(lstcon_node_ent_t));
01460                 if (dents == NULL) {
01461                         fprintf(stderr, "Failed to malloc: %s\n",
01462                                 strerror(errno));
01463                         return -1;
01464                 }
01465 
01466                 index = 0;
01467                 rc = lst_info_group_ioctl(argv[i], &gent, &index, &count, dents);
01468                 if (rc != 0) {
01469                         lst_print_error("group", "Failed to list group: %s\n",
01470                                         strerror(errno));
01471                         free(dents);
01472                         return -1;
01473                 }
01474 
01475                 for (j = 0, c = 0; j < count; j++) {
01476                         if (all ||
01477                             ((active  &&  dents[j].nde_state == LST_NODE_ACTIVE) ||
01478                              (busy    &&  dents[j].nde_state == LST_NODE_BUSY)   ||
01479                              (down    &&  dents[j].nde_state == LST_NODE_DOWN)   ||
01480                              (unknown &&  dents[j].nde_state == LST_NODE_UNKNOWN))) {
01481 
01482                                 fprintf(stdout, "\t%s: %s\n",
01483                                         libcfs_id2str(dents[j].nde_id),
01484                                         lst_node_state2str(dents[j].nde_state));
01485                                 c++;
01486                         }
01487                 }
01488 
01489                 fprintf(stdout, "Total %d nodes [ %s ]\n", c, argv[i]);
01490 
01491                 free(dents);
01492         }
01493 
01494         return rc;
01495 }
01496 
01497 int
01498 lst_stat_ioctl (char *name, int count, lnet_process_id_t *idsp,
01499                 int timeout, struct list_head *resultp)
01500 {
01501         lstio_stat_args_t args = {0};
01502 
01503         args.lstio_sta_key     = session_key;
01504         args.lstio_sta_timeout = timeout;
01505         args.lstio_sta_nmlen   = strlen(name);
01506         args.lstio_sta_namep   = name;
01507         args.lstio_sta_count   = count;
01508         args.lstio_sta_idsp    = idsp;
01509         args.lstio_sta_resultp = resultp;
01510 
01511         return lst_ioctl (LSTIO_STAT_QUERY, &args, sizeof(args));
01512 }
01513 
01514 typedef struct {
01515         struct list_head              srp_link;
01516         int                     srp_count;
01517         char                   *srp_name;
01518         lnet_process_id_t      *srp_ids;
01519         struct list_head              srp_result[2];
01520 } lst_stat_req_param_t;
01521 
01522 static void
01523 lst_stat_req_param_free(lst_stat_req_param_t *srp)
01524 {
01525         int     i;
01526 
01527         for (i = 0; i < 2; i++)
01528                 lst_free_rpcent(&srp->srp_result[i]);
01529 
01530         if (srp->srp_ids != NULL)
01531                 free(srp->srp_ids);
01532 
01533         free(srp);
01534 }
01535 
01536 static int
01537 lst_stat_req_param_alloc(char *name, lst_stat_req_param_t **srpp, int save_old)
01538 {
01539         lst_stat_req_param_t *srp = NULL;
01540         int                   count = save_old ? 2 : 1;
01541         int                   rc;
01542         int                   i;
01543 
01544         srp = malloc(sizeof(*srp));
01545         if (srp == NULL)
01546                 return -ENOMEM;
01547 
01548         memset(srp, 0, sizeof(*srp));
01549         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&srp->srp_result[0]);
01550         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&srp->srp_result[1]);
01551 
01552         rc = lst_get_node_count(LST_OPC_GROUP, name,
01553                                 &srp->srp_count, NULL);
01554         if (rc != 0 && errno == ENOENT) {
01555                 rc = lst_get_node_count(LST_OPC_NODES, name,
01556                                         &srp->srp_count, &srp->srp_ids);
01557         }
01558 
01559         if (rc != 0) {
01560                 fprintf(stderr,
01561                         "Failed to get count of nodes from %s: %s\n",
01562                         name, strerror(errno));
01563                 lst_stat_req_param_free(srp);
01564 
01565                 return rc;
01566         }
01567 
01568         srp->srp_name = name;
01569 
01570         for (i = 0; i < count; i++) {
01571                 rc = lst_alloc_rpcent(&srp->srp_result[i], srp->srp_count,
01572                                       sizeof(sfw_counters_t)  +
01573                                       sizeof(srpc_counters_t) +
01574                                       sizeof(lnet_counters_t));
01575                 if (rc != 0) {
01576                         fprintf(stderr, "Out of memory\n");
01577                         break;
01578                 }
01579         }
01580 
01581         if (rc == 0) {
01582                 *srpp = srp;
01583                 return 0;
01584         }
01585 
01586         lst_stat_req_param_free(srp);
01587 
01588         return rc;
01589 }
01590 
01591 typedef struct {
01592         /* TODO */
01593         int foo;
01594 } lst_srpc_stat_result;
01595 
01596 #define LST_LNET_AVG    0
01597 #define LST_LNET_MIN    1
01598 #define LST_LNET_MAX    2
01599 
01600 typedef struct {
01601         float           lnet_avg_sndrate;
01602         float           lnet_min_sndrate;
01603         float           lnet_max_sndrate;
01604         float           lnet_total_sndrate;
01605 
01606         float           lnet_avg_rcvrate;
01607         float           lnet_min_rcvrate;
01608         float           lnet_max_rcvrate;
01609         float           lnet_total_rcvrate;
01610 
01611         float           lnet_avg_sndperf;
01612         float           lnet_min_sndperf;
01613         float           lnet_max_sndperf;
01614         float           lnet_total_sndperf;
01615 
01616         float           lnet_avg_rcvperf;
01617         float           lnet_min_rcvperf;
01618         float           lnet_max_rcvperf;
01619         float           lnet_total_rcvperf;
01620 
01621         int             lnet_stat_count;
01622 } lst_lnet_stat_result_t;
01623 
01624 lst_lnet_stat_result_t lnet_stat_result;
01625 
01626 static float
01627 lst_lnet_stat_value(int bw, int send, int off)
01628 {
01629         float  *p;
01630 
01631         p = bw ? &lnet_stat_result.lnet_avg_sndperf :
01632                  &lnet_stat_result.lnet_avg_sndrate;
01633 
01634         if (!send)
01635                 p += 4;
01636 
01637         p += off;
01638 
01639         return *p;
01640 }
01641 
01642 static void
01643 lst_timeval_diff(struct timeval *tv1,
01644                  struct timeval *tv2, struct timeval *df)
01645 {
01646         if (tv1->tv_usec >= tv2->tv_usec) {
01647                 df->tv_sec  = tv1->tv_sec - tv2->tv_sec;
01648                 df->tv_usec = tv1->tv_usec - tv2->tv_usec;
01649                 return;
01650         }
01651 
01652         df->tv_sec  = tv1->tv_sec - 1 - tv2->tv_sec;
01653         df->tv_usec = tv1->tv_usec + 1000000 - tv2->tv_usec;
01654 
01655         return;
01656 }
01657 
01658 void
01659 lst_cal_lnet_stat(float delta, lnet_counters_t *lnet_new,
01660                   lnet_counters_t *lnet_old)
01661 {
01662         float perf;
01663         float rate;
01664 
01665         perf = (float)(lnet_new->send_length -
01666                        lnet_old->send_length) / (1024 * 1024) / delta;
01667         lnet_stat_result.lnet_total_sndperf += perf;
01668 
01669         if (lnet_stat_result.lnet_min_sndperf > perf ||
01670             lnet_stat_result.lnet_min_sndperf == 0)
01671                 lnet_stat_result.lnet_min_sndperf = perf;
01672 
01673         if (lnet_stat_result.lnet_max_sndperf < perf)
01674                 lnet_stat_result.lnet_max_sndperf = perf;
01675 
01676         perf = (float)(lnet_new->recv_length -
01677                        lnet_old->recv_length) / (1024 * 1024) / delta;
01678         lnet_stat_result.lnet_total_rcvperf += perf;
01679 
01680         if (lnet_stat_result.lnet_min_rcvperf > perf ||
01681             lnet_stat_result.lnet_min_rcvperf == 0)
01682                 lnet_stat_result.lnet_min_rcvperf = perf;
01683 
01684         if (lnet_stat_result.lnet_max_rcvperf < perf)
01685                 lnet_stat_result.lnet_max_rcvperf = perf;
01686 
01687         rate = (lnet_new->send_count - lnet_old->send_count) / delta;
01688         lnet_stat_result.lnet_total_sndrate += rate;
01689 
01690         if (lnet_stat_result.lnet_min_sndrate > rate ||
01691             lnet_stat_result.lnet_min_sndrate == 0)
01692                 lnet_stat_result.lnet_min_sndrate = rate;
01693 
01694         if (lnet_stat_result.lnet_max_sndrate < rate)
01695                 lnet_stat_result.lnet_max_sndrate = rate;
01696 
01697         rate = (lnet_new->recv_count - lnet_old->recv_count) / delta;
01698         lnet_stat_result.lnet_total_rcvrate += rate;
01699 
01700         if (lnet_stat_result.lnet_min_rcvrate > rate ||
01701             lnet_stat_result.lnet_min_rcvrate == 0)
01702                 lnet_stat_result.lnet_min_rcvrate = rate;
01703 
01704         if (lnet_stat_result.lnet_max_rcvrate < rate)
01705                 lnet_stat_result.lnet_max_rcvrate = rate;
01706 
01707         lnet_stat_result.lnet_stat_count ++;
01708 
01709         lnet_stat_result.lnet_avg_sndrate = lnet_stat_result.lnet_total_sndrate /
01710                                             lnet_stat_result.lnet_stat_count;
01711         lnet_stat_result.lnet_avg_rcvrate = lnet_stat_result.lnet_total_rcvrate /
01712                                             lnet_stat_result.lnet_stat_count;
01713 
01714         lnet_stat_result.lnet_avg_sndperf = lnet_stat_result.lnet_total_sndperf /
01715                                             lnet_stat_result.lnet_stat_count;
01716         lnet_stat_result.lnet_avg_rcvperf = lnet_stat_result.lnet_total_rcvperf /
01717                                             lnet_stat_result.lnet_stat_count;
01718 
01719 }
01720 
01721 void
01722 lst_print_lnet_stat(char *name, int bwrt, int rdwr, int type)
01723 {
01724         int     start1 = 0;
01725         int     end1   = 1;
01726         int     start2 = 0;
01727         int     end2   = 1;
01728         int     i;
01729         int     j;
01730 
01731         if (lnet_stat_result.lnet_stat_count == 0)
01732                 return;
01733 
01734         if (bwrt == 1) /* bw only */
01735                 start1 = 1;
01736 
01737         if (bwrt == 2) /* rates only */
01738                 end1 = 0;
01739 
01740         if (rdwr == 1) /* recv only */
01741                 start2 = 1;
01742 
01743         if (rdwr == 2) /* send only */
01744                 end2 = 0;
01745 
01746         for (i = start1; i <= end1; i++) {
01747                 fprintf(stdout, "[LNet %s of %s]\n",
01748                         i == 0 ? "Rates" : "Bandwidth", name);
01749 
01750                 for (j = start2; j <= end2; j++) {
01751                         fprintf(stdout, "[%c] ", j == 0 ? 'R' : 'W');
01752 
01753                         if ((type & 1) != 0) {
01754                                 fprintf(stdout, i == 0 ? "Avg: %-8.0f RPC/s " :
01755                                                          "Avg: %-8.2f MB/s  ",
01756                                         lst_lnet_stat_value(i, j, 0));
01757                         }
01758 
01759                         if ((type & 2) != 0) {
01760                                 fprintf(stdout, i == 0 ? "Min: %-8.0f RPC/s " :
01761                                                          "Min: %-8.2f MB/s  ",
01762                                         lst_lnet_stat_value(i, j, 1));
01763                         }
01764 
01765                         if ((type & 4) != 0) {
01766                                 fprintf(stdout, i == 0 ? "Max: %-8.0f RPC/s" :
01767                                                          "Max: %-8.2f MB/s",
01768                                         lst_lnet_stat_value(i, j, 2));
01769                         }
01770 
01771                         fprintf(stdout, "\n");
01772                 }
01773         }
01774 }
01775 
01776 void
01777 lst_print_stat(char *name, struct list_head *resultp,
01778                int idx, int lnet, int bwrt, int rdwr, int type)
01779 {
01780         struct list_head        tmp[2];
01781         lstcon_rpc_ent_t *new;
01782         lstcon_rpc_ent_t *old;
01783         sfw_counters_t   *sfwk_new;
01784         sfw_counters_t   *sfwk_old;
01785         srpc_counters_t  *srpc_new;
01786         srpc_counters_t  *srpc_old;
01787         lnet_counters_t  *lnet_new;
01788         lnet_counters_t  *lnet_old;
01789         float             delta;
01790         int               errcount = 0;
01791 
01792         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&tmp[0]);
01793         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&tmp[1]);
01794 
01795         memset(&lnet_stat_result, 0, sizeof(lnet_stat_result));
01796 
01797         while (!list_empty(&resultp[idx])) {
01798                 if (list_empty(&resultp[1 - idx])) {
01799                         fprintf(stderr, "Group is changed, re-run stat\n");
01800                         break;
01801                 }
01802 
01803                 new = list_entry(resultp[idx].next, lstcon_rpc_ent_t,
01804                                      rpe_link);
01805                 old = list_entry(resultp[1 - idx].next, lstcon_rpc_ent_t,
01806                                      rpe_link);
01807 
01808                 /* first time get stats result, can't calculate diff */
01809                 if (new->rpe_peer.nid == LNET_NID_ANY)
01810                         break;
01811 
01812                 if (new->rpe_peer.nid != old->rpe_peer.nid ||
01813                     new->rpe_peer.pid != old->rpe_peer.pid) {
01814                         /* Something wrong. i.e, somebody change the group */
01815                         break;
01816                 }
01817 
01818                 list_del(&new->rpe_link);
01819                 list_add_tail(&new->rpe_link, &tmp[idx]);
01820 
01821                 list_del(&old->rpe_link);
01822                 list_add_tail(&old->rpe_link, &tmp[1 - idx]);
01823 
01824                 if (new->rpe_rpc_errno != 0 || new->rpe_fwk_errno != 0 ||
01825                     old->rpe_rpc_errno != 0 || old->rpe_fwk_errno != 0) {
01826                         errcount ++;
01827                         continue;
01828                 }
01829 
01830                 sfwk_new = (sfw_counters_t *)&new->rpe_payload[0];
01831                 sfwk_old = (sfw_counters_t *)&old->rpe_payload[0];
01832 
01833                 srpc_new = (srpc_counters_t *)((char *)sfwk_new + sizeof(*sfwk_new));
01834                 srpc_old = (srpc_counters_t *)((char *)sfwk_old + sizeof(*sfwk_old));
01835 
01836                 lnet_new = (lnet_counters_t *)((char *)srpc_new + sizeof(*srpc_new));
01837                 lnet_old = (lnet_counters_t *)((char *)srpc_old + sizeof(*srpc_old));
01838 
01839                 /* Prior to version 2.3, the running_ms field was a counter for
01840                  * the number of running tests.  We are looking at this value
01841                  * to determine if it is a millisecond timestamep (>= 2.3) or a
01842                  * test counter (< 2.3).  The number 500 is being used for this
01843                  * barrier as the test counter should never get this high, and
01844                  * the timestamp should never get this low. */
01845 
01846                 if (sfwk_new->running_ms > 500) {
01847                         /* use the timestamp from the remote node, not our
01848                          * rpe_stamp from when we copied up the data out of
01849                          * the kernel */
01850 
01851                         delta = (float) (sfwk_new->running_ms -
01852                                         sfwk_old->running_ms) / 1000;
01853                 } else {
01854                         struct timeval    tv;
01855 
01856                         lst_timeval_diff(&new->rpe_stamp, &old->rpe_stamp, &tv);
01857                         delta = tv.tv_sec + (float)tv.tv_usec / 1000000;
01858                 }
01859 
01860                 if (!lnet) /* TODO */
01861                         continue;
01862 
01863                 lst_cal_lnet_stat(delta, lnet_new, lnet_old);
01864         }
01865 
01866         list_splice(&tmp[idx], &resultp[idx]);
01867         list_splice(&tmp[1 - idx], &resultp[1 - idx]);
01868 
01869         if (errcount > 0)
01870                 fprintf(stdout, "Failed to stat on %d nodes\n", errcount);
01871 
01872         if (!lnet)  /* TODO */
01873                 return;
01874 
01875         lst_print_lnet_stat(name, bwrt, rdwr, type);
01876 }
01877 
01878 int
01879 jt_lst_stat(int argc, char **argv)
01880 {
01881         struct list_head        head;
01882         lst_stat_req_param_t *srp;
01883         time_t                last    = 0;
01884         int                   optidx  = 0;
01885         int                   timeout = 5; /* default timeout, 5 sec */
01886         int                   delay   = 5; /* default delay, 5 sec */
01887         int                   count   = -1; /* run forever */
01888         int                   lnet    = 1; /* lnet stat by default */
01889         int                   bwrt    = 0;
01890         int                   rdwr    = 0;
01891         int                   type    = -1;
01892         int                   idx     = 0;
01893         int                   rc;
01894         int                   c;
01895 
01896         static struct option stat_opts[] =
01897         {
01898                 {"timeout"   , required_argument, 0, 't' },
01899                 {"delay"     , required_argument, 0, 'd' },
01900                 {"count"     , required_argument, 0, 'o' },
01901                 {"lnet"      , no_argument,      0, 'l' },
01902                 {"rpc"       , no_argument,      0, 'c' },
01903                 {"bw"        , no_argument,      0, 'b' },
01904                 {"rate"      , no_argument,      0, 'a' },
01905                 {"read"      , no_argument,      0, 'r' },
01906                 {"write"     , no_argument,      0, 'w' },
01907                 {"avg"       , no_argument,      0, 'g' },
01908                 {"min"       , no_argument,      0, 'n' },
01909                 {"max"       , no_argument,      0, 'x' },
01910                 {0,            0,                0,  0  }
01911         };
01912 
01913         if (session_key == 0) {
01914                 fprintf(stderr,
01915                         "Can't find env LST_SESSION or value is not valid\n");
01916                 return -1;
01917         }
01918 
01919         while (1) {
01920                 c = getopt_long(argc, argv, "t:d:lcbarwgnx", stat_opts, &optidx);
01921 
01922                 if (c == -1)
01923                         break;
01924 
01925                 switch (c) {
01926                 case 't':
01927                         timeout = atoi(optarg);
01928                         break;
01929                 case 'd':
01930                         delay = atoi(optarg);
01931                         break;
01932                 case 'o':
01933                         count = atoi(optarg);
01934                         break;
01935                 case 'l':
01936                         lnet = 1;
01937                         break;
01938                 case 'c':
01939                         lnet = 0;
01940                         break;
01941                 case 'b':
01942                         bwrt |= 1;
01943                         break;
01944                 case 'a':
01945                         bwrt |= 2;
01946                         break;
01947                 case 'r':
01948                         rdwr |= 1;
01949                         break;
01950                 case 'w':
01951                         rdwr |= 2;
01952                         break;
01953                 case 'g':
01954                         if (type == -1) {
01955                                 type = 1;
01956                                 break;
01957                         }
01958                         type |= 1;
01959                         break;
01960                 case 'n':
01961                         if (type == -1) {
01962                                 type = 2;
01963                                 break;
01964                         }
01965                         type |= 2;
01966                         break;
01967                 case 'x':
01968                         if (type == -1) {
01969                                 type = 4;
01970                                 break;
01971                         }
01972                         type |= 4;
01973                         break;
01974 
01975                 default:
01976                         lst_print_usage(argv[0]);
01977                         return -1;
01978                 }
01979         }
01980 
01981         if (optind == argc) {
01982                 lst_print_usage(argv[0]);
01983                 return -1;
01984         }
01985 
01986         if (timeout <= 0 || delay <= 0) {
01987                 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid timeout or delay value\n");
01988                 return -1;
01989         }
01990 
01991         if (count < -1) {
01992             fprintf(stderr, "Invalid count value\n");
01993             return -1;
01994         }
01995 
01996         /* extra count to get first data point */
01997         if (count != -1)
01998             count++;
01999 
02000         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&head);
02001 
02002         while (optind < argc) {
02003                 rc = lst_stat_req_param_alloc(argv[optind++], &srp, 1);
02004                 if (rc != 0)
02005                         goto out;
02006 
02007                 list_add_tail(&srp->srp_link, &head);
02008         }
02009 
02010         do {
02011                 time_t  now = time(NULL);
02012 
02013                 if (now - last < delay) {
02014                         sleep(delay - now + last);
02015                         time(&now);
02016                 }
02017                 last = now;
02018 
02019                 list_for_each_entry(srp, &head, srp_link) {
02020                         rc = lst_stat_ioctl(srp->srp_name,
02021                                             srp->srp_count, srp->srp_ids,
02022                                             timeout, &srp->srp_result[idx]);
02023                         if (rc == -1) {
02024                                 lst_print_error("stat", "Failed to stat %s: %s\n",
02025                                                 srp->srp_name, strerror(errno));
02026                                 goto out;
02027                         }
02028 
02029                         lst_print_stat(srp->srp_name, srp->srp_result,
02030                                        idx, lnet, bwrt, rdwr, type);
02031 
02032                         lst_reset_rpcent(&srp->srp_result[1 - idx]);
02033                 }
02034 
02035                 idx = 1 - idx;
02036 
02037                 if (count > 0)
02038                         count--;
02039         } while (count == -1 || count > 0);
02040 
02041 out:
02042         while (!list_empty(&head)) {
02043                 srp = list_entry(head.next, lst_stat_req_param_t, srp_link);
02044 
02045                 list_del(&srp->srp_link);
02046                 lst_stat_req_param_free(srp);
02047         }
02048 
02049         return rc;
02050 }
02051 
02052 int
02053 jt_lst_show_error(int argc, char **argv)
02054 {
02055         struct list_head            head;
02056         lst_stat_req_param_t *srp;
02057         lstcon_rpc_ent_t     *ent;
02058         sfw_counters_t       *sfwk;
02059         srpc_counters_t      *srpc;
02060         int                   show_rpc = 1;
02061         int                   optidx   = 0;
02062         int                   rc       = 0;
02063         int                   ecount;
02064         int                   c;
02065 
02066         static struct option  show_error_opts[] =
02067         {
02068                 {"session", no_argument,       0, 's' },
02069                 {0,         0,                 0,  0  }
02070         };
02071 
02072         if (session_key == 0) {
02073                 fprintf(stderr,
02074                         "Can't find env LST_SESSION or value is not valid\n");
02075                 return -1;
02076         }
02077 
02078         while (1) {
02079                 c = getopt_long(argc, argv, "s", show_error_opts, &optidx);
02080 
02081                 if (c == -1)
02082                         break;
02083 
02084                 switch (c) {
02085                 case 's':
02086                         show_rpc  = 0;
02087                         break;
02088 
02089                 default:
02090                         lst_print_usage(argv[0]);
02091                         return -1;
02092                 }
02093         }
02094 
02095         if (optind == argc) {
02096                 lst_print_usage(argv[0]);
02097                 return -1;
02098         }
02099 
02100         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&head);
02101 
02102         while (optind < argc) {
02103                 rc = lst_stat_req_param_alloc(argv[optind++], &srp, 0);
02104                 if (rc != 0)
02105                         goto out;
02106 
02107                 list_add_tail(&srp->srp_link, &head);
02108         }
02109 
02110         list_for_each_entry(srp, &head, srp_link) {
02111                 rc = lst_stat_ioctl(srp->srp_name, srp->srp_count,
02112                                     srp->srp_ids, 10, &srp->srp_result[0]);
02113 
02114                 if (rc == -1) {
02115                         lst_print_error(srp->srp_name, "Failed to show errors of %s: %s\n",
02116                                         srp->srp_name, strerror(errno));
02117                         goto out;
02118                 }
02119 
02120                 fprintf(stdout, "%s:\n", srp->srp_name);
02121 
02122                 ecount = 0;
02123 
02124                 list_for_each_entry(ent, &srp->srp_result[0], rpe_link) {
02125                         if (ent->rpe_rpc_errno != 0) {
02126                                 ecount ++;
02127                                 fprintf(stderr, "RPC failure, can't show error on %s\n",
02128                                         libcfs_id2str(ent->rpe_peer));
02129                                 continue;
02130                         }
02131 
02132                         if (ent->rpe_fwk_errno != 0) {
02133                                 ecount ++;
02134                                 fprintf(stderr, "Framework failure, can't show error on %s\n",
02135                                         libcfs_id2str(ent->rpe_peer));
02136                                 continue;
02137                         }
02138 
02139                         sfwk = (sfw_counters_t *)&ent->rpe_payload[0];
02140                         srpc = (srpc_counters_t *)((char *)sfwk + sizeof(*sfwk));
02141 
02142                         if (srpc->errors == 0 &&
02143                             sfwk->brw_errors == 0 && sfwk->ping_errors == 0)
02144                                 continue;
02145 
02146                         if (!show_rpc  &&
02147                             sfwk->brw_errors == 0 && sfwk->ping_errors == 0)
02148                                 continue;
02149 
02150                         ecount ++;
02151 
02152                         fprintf(stderr, "%s: [Session %d brw errors, %d ping errors]%c",
02153                                 libcfs_id2str(ent->rpe_peer),
02154                                 sfwk->brw_errors, sfwk->ping_errors,
02155                                 show_rpc  ? ' ' : '\n');
02156 
02157                         if (!show_rpc)
02158                                 continue;
02159 
02160                         fprintf(stderr, "[RPC: %d errors, %d dropped, %d expired]\n",
02161                                 srpc->errors, srpc->rpcs_dropped, srpc->rpcs_expired);
02162                 }
02163 
02164                 fprintf(stdout, "Total %d error nodes in %s\n", ecount, srp->srp_name);
02165         }
02166 out:
02167         while (!list_empty(&head)) {
02168                 srp = list_entry(head.next, lst_stat_req_param_t, srp_link);
02169 
02170                 list_del(&srp->srp_link);
02171                 lst_stat_req_param_free(srp);
02172         }
02173 
02174         return rc;
02175 }
02176 
02177 int
02178 lst_add_batch_ioctl (char *name)
02179 {
02180         lstio_batch_add_args_t args = {0};
02181 
02182         args.lstio_bat_key   = session_key;
02183         args.lstio_bat_nmlen = strlen(name);
02184         args.lstio_bat_namep = name;
02185 
02186         return lst_ioctl (LSTIO_BATCH_ADD, &args, sizeof(args));
02187 }
02188 
02189 int
02190 jt_lst_add_batch(int argc, char **argv)
02191 {
02192         char   *name;
02193         int     rc;
02194 
02195         if (session_key == 0) {
02196                 fprintf(stderr,
02197                         "Can't find env LST_SESSION or value is not valid\n");
02198                 return -1;
02199         }
02200 
02201         if (argc != 2) {
02202                 lst_print_usage(argv[0]);
02203                 return -1;
02204         }
02205 
02206         name = argv[1];
02207         if (strlen(name) >= LST_NAME_SIZE) {
02208                 fprintf(stderr, "Name length is limited to %d\n",
02209                         LST_NAME_SIZE - 1);
02210                 return -1;
02211         }
02212 
02213         rc = lst_add_batch_ioctl(name);
02214         if (rc == 0)
02215                 return 0;
02216 
02217         lst_print_error("batch", "Failed to create batch: %s\n",
02218                         strerror(errno));
02219 
02220         return -1;
02221 }
02222 
02223 int
02224 lst_start_batch_ioctl(char *name, int timeout, struct list_head *resultp)
02225 {
02226         lstio_batch_run_args_t args = {0};
02227 
02228         args.lstio_bat_key     = session_key;
02229         args.lstio_bat_timeout = timeout;
02230         args.lstio_bat_nmlen   = strlen(name);
02231         args.lstio_bat_namep   = name;
02232         args.lstio_bat_resultp = resultp;
02233 
02234         return lst_ioctl(LSTIO_BATCH_START, &args, sizeof(args));
02235 }
02236 
02237 int
02238 jt_lst_start_batch(int argc, char **argv)
02239 {
02240         struct list_head        head;
02241         char             *batch;
02242         int               optidx  = 0;
02243         int               timeout = 0;
02244         int               count = 0;
02245         int               rc;
02246         int               c;
02247 
02248         static struct option start_batch_opts[] =
02249         {
02250                 {"timeout", required_argument, 0, 't' },
02251                 {0,         0,                 0,  0  }
02252         };
02253 
02254         if (session_key == 0) {
02255                 fprintf(stderr,
02256                         "Can't find env LST_SESSION or value is not valid\n");
02257                 return -1;
02258         }
02259 
02260         while (1) {
02261                 c = getopt_long(argc, argv, "t:",
02262                                 start_batch_opts, &optidx);
02263 
02264                 /* Detect the end of the options. */
02265                 if (c == -1)
02266                         break;
02267 
02268                 switch (c) {
02269                 case 't':
02270                         timeout = atoi(optarg);
02271                         break;
02272                 default:
02273                         lst_print_usage(argv[0]);
02274                         return -1;
02275                 }
02276         }
02277 
02278         if (optind == argc) {
02279                 batch = LST_DEFAULT_BATCH;
02280 
02281         } else if (optind == argc - 1) {
02282                 batch = argv[optind];
02283 
02284         } else {
02285                 lst_print_usage(argv[0]);
02286                 return -1;
02287         }
02288 
02289         rc = lst_get_node_count(LST_OPC_BATCHCLI, batch, &count, NULL);
02290         if (rc != 0) {
02291                 fprintf(stderr, "Failed to get count of nodes from %s: %s\n",
02292                         batch, strerror(errno));
02293                 return -1;
02294         }
02295 
02296         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&head);
02297 
02298         rc = lst_alloc_rpcent(&head, count, 0);
02299         if (rc != 0) {
02300                 fprintf(stderr, "Out of memory\n");
02301                 return -1;
02302         }
02303 
02304         rc = lst_start_batch_ioctl(batch, timeout, &head);
02305 
02306         if (rc == 0) {
02307                 fprintf(stdout, "%s is running now\n", batch);
02308                 lst_free_rpcent(&head);
02309                 return 0;
02310         }
02311 
02312         if (rc == -1) {
02313                 lst_print_error("batch", "Failed to start batch: %s\n",
02314                                 strerror(errno));
02315                 lst_free_rpcent(&head);
02316                 return rc;
02317         }
02318 
02319         lst_print_transerr(&head, "Run batch");
02320 
02321         lst_free_rpcent(&head);
02322 
02323         return rc;
02324 }
02325 
02326 int
02327 lst_stop_batch_ioctl(char *name, int force, struct list_head *resultp)
02328 {
02329         lstio_batch_stop_args_t args = {0};
02330 
02331         args.lstio_bat_key     = session_key;
02332         args.lstio_bat_force   = force;
02333         args.lstio_bat_nmlen   = strlen(name);
02334         args.lstio_bat_namep   = name;
02335         args.lstio_bat_resultp = resultp;
02336 
02337         return lst_ioctl(LSTIO_BATCH_STOP, &args, sizeof(args));
02338 }
02339 
02340 int
02341 jt_lst_stop_batch(int argc, char **argv)
02342 {
02343         struct list_head        head;
02344         char             *batch;
02345         int               force = 0;
02346         int               optidx;
02347         int               count;
02348         int               rc;
02349         int               c;
02350 
02351         static struct option stop_batch_opts[] =
02352         {
02353                 {"force",   no_argument,   0, 'f' },
02354                 {0,         0,             0,  0  }
02355         };
02356 
02357         if (session_key == 0) {
02358                 fprintf(stderr,
02359                         "Can't find env LST_SESSION or value is not valid\n");
02360                 return -1;
02361         }
02362 
02363         while (1) {
02364                 c = getopt_long(argc, argv, "f",
02365                                 stop_batch_opts, &optidx);
02366 
02367                 /* Detect the end of the options. */
02368                 if (c == -1)
02369                         break;
02370 
02371                 switch (c) {
02372                 case 'f':
02373                         force = 1;
02374                         break;
02375                 default:
02376                         lst_print_usage(argv[0]);
02377                         return -1;
02378                 }
02379         }
02380 
02381         if (optind == argc) {
02382                 batch = LST_DEFAULT_BATCH;
02383 
02384         } else if (optind == argc - 1) {
02385                 batch = argv[optind];
02386 
02387         } else {
02388                 lst_print_usage(argv[0]);
02389                 return -1;
02390         }
02391 
02392         rc = lst_get_node_count(LST_OPC_BATCHCLI, batch, &count, NULL);
02393         if (rc != 0) {
02394                 fprintf(stderr, "Failed to get count of nodes from %s: %s\n",
02395                         batch, strerror(errno));
02396                 return -1;
02397         }
02398 
02399         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&head);
02400 
02401         rc = lst_alloc_rpcent(&head, count, 0);
02402         if (rc != 0) {
02403                 fprintf(stderr, "Out of memory\n");
02404                 return -1;
02405         }
02406 
02407         rc = lst_stop_batch_ioctl(batch, force, &head);
02408         if (rc != 0)
02409                 goto out;
02410 
02411         while (1) {
02412                 lst_reset_rpcent(&head);
02413 
02414                 rc = lst_query_batch_ioctl(batch, 0, 0, 30, &head);
02415                 if (rc != 0)
02416                         goto out;
02417 
02418                 if (lstcon_tsbqry_stat_run(&trans_stat, 0)  == 0 &&
02419                     lstcon_tsbqry_stat_failure(&trans_stat, 0) == 0)
02420                         break;
02421 
02422                 fprintf(stdout, "%d batch in stopping\n",
02423                         lstcon_tsbqry_stat_run(&trans_stat, 0));
02424                 sleep(1);
02425         }
02426 
02427         fprintf(stdout, "Batch is stopped\n");
02428         lst_free_rpcent(&head);
02429 
02430         return 0;
02431 out:
02432         if (rc == -1) {
02433                 lst_print_error("batch", "Failed to stop batch: %s\n",
02434                                 strerror(errno));
02435                 lst_free_rpcent(&head);
02436                 return -1;
02437         }
02438 
02439         lst_print_transerr(&head, "stop batch");
02440 
02441         lst_free_rpcent(&head);
02442 
02443         return rc;
02444 }
02445 
02446 int
02447 lst_list_batch_ioctl(int len, char *name, int index)
02448 {
02449         lstio_batch_list_args_t args = {0};
02450 
02451         args.lstio_bat_key   = session_key;
02452         args.lstio_bat_idx   = index;
02453         args.lstio_bat_nmlen = len;
02454         args.lstio_bat_namep = name;
02455 
02456         return lst_ioctl(LSTIO_BATCH_LIST, &args, sizeof(args));
02457 }
02458 
02459 int
02460 lst_info_batch_ioctl(char *batch, int test, int server,
02461                      lstcon_test_batch_ent_t *entp, int *idxp,
02462                      int *ndentp, lstcon_node_ent_t *dentsp)
02463 {
02464         lstio_batch_info_args_t args = {0};
02465 
02466         args.lstio_bat_key     = session_key;
02467         args.lstio_bat_nmlen   = strlen(batch);
02468         args.lstio_bat_namep   = batch;
02469         args.lstio_bat_server  = server;
02470         args.lstio_bat_testidx = test;
02471         args.lstio_bat_entp    = entp;
02472         args.lstio_bat_idxp    = idxp;
02473         args.lstio_bat_ndentp  = ndentp;
02474         args.lstio_bat_dentsp  = dentsp;
02475 
02476         return lst_ioctl(LSTIO_BATCH_INFO, &args, sizeof(args));
02477 }
02478 
02479 int
02480 lst_list_batch_all(void)
02481 {
02482         char name[LST_NAME_SIZE];
02483         int  rc;
02484         int  i;
02485 
02486         for (i = 0; ; i++) {
02487                 rc = lst_list_batch_ioctl(LST_NAME_SIZE, name, i);
02488                 if (rc == 0) {
02489                         fprintf(stdout, "%d) %s\n", i + 1, name);
02490                         continue;
02491                 }
02492 
02493                 if (errno == ENOENT)
02494                         break;
02495 
02496                 lst_print_error("batch", "Failed to list batch: %s\n",
02497                                 strerror(errno));
02498                 return rc;
02499         }
02500 
02501         fprintf(stdout, "Total %d batches\n", i);
02502 
02503         return 0;
02504 }
02505 
02506 int
02507 lst_list_tsb_nodes(char *batch, int test, int server,
02508                    int count, int active, int invalid)
02509 {
02510         lstcon_node_ent_t *dents;
02511         int                index = 0;
02512         int                rc;
02513         int                c;
02514         int                i;
02515 
02516         if (count == 0)
02517                 return 0;
02518 
02519         /* verbose list, show nodes in batch or test */
02520         dents = malloc(count * sizeof(lstcon_node_ent_t));
02521         if (dents == NULL) {
02522                 fprintf(stdout, "Can't allocate memory\n");
02523                 return -1;
02524         }
02525 
02526         rc = lst_info_batch_ioctl(batch, test, server,
02527                                   NULL, &index, &count, dents);
02528         if (rc != 0) {
02529                 free(dents);
02530                 lst_print_error((test > 0) ? "test" : "batch",
02531                                 (test > 0) ? "Failed to query test: %s\n" :
02532                                              "Failed to query batch: %s\n",
02533                                 strerror(errno));
02534                 return -1;
02535         }
02536 
02537         for (i = 0, c = 0; i < count; i++) {
02538                 if ((!active  && dents[i].nde_state == LST_NODE_ACTIVE) ||
02539                     (!invalid && (dents[i].nde_state == LST_NODE_BUSY  ||
02540                                   dents[i].nde_state == LST_NODE_DOWN  ||
02541                                   dents[i].nde_state == LST_NODE_UNKNOWN)))
02542                         continue;
02543 
02544                 fprintf(stdout, "\t%s: %s\n",
02545                         libcfs_id2str(dents[i].nde_id),
02546                         lst_node_state2str(dents[i].nde_state));
02547                 c++;
02548         }
02549 
02550         fprintf(stdout, "Total %d nodes\n", c);
02551         free(dents);
02552 
02553         return 0;
02554 }
02555 
02556 int
02557 jt_lst_list_batch(int argc, char **argv)
02558 {
02559         lstcon_test_batch_ent_t ent;
02560         char                *batch   = NULL;
02561         int                  optidx  = 0;
02562         int                  verbose = 0; /* list nodes in batch or test */
02563         int                  invalid = 0;
02564         int                  active  = 0;
02565         int                  server  = 0;
02566         int                  ntest   = 0;
02567         int                  test    = 0;
02568         int                  c       = 0;
02569         int                  rc;
02570 
02571         static struct option list_batch_opts[] =
02572         {
02573                 {"test",    required_argument, 0, 't' },
02574                 {"invalid", no_argument,       0, 'i' },
02575                 {"active",  no_argument,       0, 'a' },
02576                 {"all",     no_argument,       0, 'l' },
02577                 {"server",  no_argument,       0, 's' },
02578                 {0,         0,                 0,  0  }
02579         };
02580 
02581         if (session_key == 0) {
02582                 fprintf(stderr,
02583                         "Can't find env LST_SESSION or value is not valid\n");
02584                 return -1;
02585         }
02586 
02587         while (1) {
02588                 c = getopt_long(argc, argv, "ailst:",
02589                                 list_batch_opts, &optidx);
02590 
02591                 if (c == -1)
02592                         break;
02593 
02594                 switch (c) {
02595                 case 'a':
02596                         verbose = active = 1;
02597                         break;
02598                 case 'i':
02599                         verbose = invalid = 1;
02600                         break;
02601                 case 'l':
02602                         verbose = active = invalid = 1;
02603                         break;
02604                 case 's':
02605                         server = 1;
02606                         break;
02607                 case 't':
02608                         test = atoi(optarg);
02609                         ntest = 1;
02610                         break;
02611                 default:
02612                         lst_print_usage(argv[0]);
02613                         return -1;
02614                 }
02615         }
02616 
02617         if (optind == argc) {
02618                 /* list all batches */
02619                 rc = lst_list_batch_all();
02620                 return rc;
02621         }
02622 
02623         if (ntest == 1 && test <= 0) {
02624                 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid test id, test id starts from 1\n");
02625                 return -1;
02626         }
02627 
02628         if (optind != argc - 1) {
02629                 lst_print_usage(argv[0]);
02630                 return -1;
02631         }
02632 
02633         batch = argv[optind];
02634 
02635 loop:
02636         /* show detail of specified batch or test */
02637         rc = lst_info_batch_ioctl(batch, test, server,
02638                                   &ent, NULL, NULL, NULL);
02639         if (rc != 0) {
02640                 lst_print_error((test > 0) ? "test" : "batch",
02641                                 (test > 0) ? "Failed to query test: %s\n" :
02642                                              "Failed to query batch: %s\n",
02643                                 strerror(errno));
02644                 return -1;
02645         }
02646 
02647         if (verbose) {
02648                 /* list nodes in test or batch */
02649                 rc = lst_list_tsb_nodes(batch, test, server,
02650                                         server ? ent.tbe_srv_nle.nle_nnode :
02651                                                  ent.tbe_cli_nle.nle_nnode,
02652                                         active, invalid);
02653                 return rc;
02654         }
02655 
02656         /* only show number of hosts in batch or test */
02657         if (test == 0) {
02658                 fprintf(stdout, "Batch: %s Tests: %d State: %d\n",
02659                         batch, ent.u.tbe_batch.bae_ntest,
02660                         ent.u.tbe_batch.bae_state);
02661                 ntest = ent.u.tbe_batch.bae_ntest;
02662                 test = 1; /* starting from test 1 */
02663 
02664         } else {
02665                 fprintf(stdout,
02666                         "\tTest %d(%s) (loop: %d, concurrency: %d)\n",
02667                         test, lst_test_type2name(ent.u.tbe_test.tse_type),
02668                         ent.u.tbe_test.tse_loop,
02669                         ent.u.tbe_test.tse_concur);
02670                 ntest --;
02671                 test ++;
02672         }
02673 
02674         fprintf(stdout, LST_NODES_TITLE);
02675         fprintf(stdout, "client\t%d\t%d\t%d\t%d\t%d\n"
02676                         "server\t%d\t%d\t%d\t%d\t%d\n",
02677                 ent.tbe_cli_nle.nle_nactive,
02678                 ent.tbe_cli_nle.nle_nbusy,
02679                 ent.tbe_cli_nle.nle_ndown,
02680                 ent.tbe_cli_nle.nle_nunknown,
02681                 ent.tbe_cli_nle.nle_nnode,
02682                 ent.tbe_srv_nle.nle_nactive,
02683                 ent.tbe_srv_nle.nle_nbusy,
02684                 ent.tbe_srv_nle.nle_ndown,
02685                 ent.tbe_srv_nle.nle_nunknown,
02686                 ent.tbe_srv_nle.nle_nnode);
02687 
02688         if (ntest != 0)
02689                 goto loop;
02690 
02691         return 0;
02692 }
02693 
02694 int
02695 lst_query_batch_ioctl(char *batch, int test, int server,
02696                       int timeout, struct list_head *head)
02697 {
02698         lstio_batch_query_args_t args = {0};
02699 
02700         args.lstio_bat_key     = session_key;
02701         args.lstio_bat_testidx = test;
02702         args.lstio_bat_client  = !(server);
02703         args.lstio_bat_timeout = timeout;
02704         args.lstio_bat_nmlen   = strlen(batch);
02705         args.lstio_bat_namep   = batch;
02706         args.lstio_bat_resultp = head;
02707 
02708         return lst_ioctl(LSTIO_BATCH_QUERY, &args, sizeof(args));
02709 }
02710 
02711 void
02712 lst_print_tsb_verbose(struct list_head *head,
02713                       int active, int idle, int error)
02714 {
02715         lstcon_rpc_ent_t *ent;
02716 
02717         list_for_each_entry(ent, head, rpe_link) {
02718                 if (ent->rpe_priv[0] == 0 && active)
02719                         continue;
02720 
02721                 if (ent->rpe_priv[0] != 0 && idle)
02722                         continue;
02723 
02724                 if (ent->rpe_fwk_errno == 0 && error)
02725                         continue;
02726 
02727                 fprintf(stdout, "%s [%s]: %s\n",
02728                         libcfs_id2str(ent->rpe_peer),
02729                         lst_node_state2str(ent->rpe_state),
02730                         ent->rpe_rpc_errno != 0 ?
02731                                 strerror(ent->rpe_rpc_errno) :
02732                                 (ent->rpe_priv[0] > 0 ? "Running" : "Idle"));
02733         }
02734 }
02735 
02736 int
02737 jt_lst_query_batch(int argc, char **argv)
02738 {
02739         lstcon_test_batch_ent_t ent;
02740         struct list_head              head;
02741         char                   *batch   = NULL;
02742         time_t                  last    = 0;
02743         int                     optidx  = 0;
02744         int                     verbose = 0;
02745         int                     server  = 0;
02746         int                     timeout = 5; /* default 5 seconds */
02747         int                     delay   = 5; /* default 5 seconds */
02748         int                     loop    = 1; /* default 1 loop */
02749         int                     active  = 0;
02750         int                     error   = 0;
02751         int                     idle    = 0;
02752         int                     count   = 0;
02753         int                     test    = 0;
02754         int                     rc      = 0;
02755         int                     c       = 0;
02756         int                     i;
02757 
02758         static struct option query_batch_opts[] =
02759         {
02760                 {"timeout", required_argument, 0, 'o' },
02761                 {"delay",   required_argument, 0, 'd' },
02762                 {"loop",    required_argument, 0, 'c' },
02763                 {"test",    required_argument, 0, 't' },
02764                 {"server",  no_argument,       0, 's' },
02765                 {"active",  no_argument,       0, 'a' },
02766                 {"idle",    no_argument,       0, 'i' },
02767                 {"error",   no_argument,       0, 'e' },
02768                 {"all",     no_argument,       0, 'l' },
02769                 {0,         0,                 0,  0  }
02770         };
02771 
02772         if (session_key == 0) {
02773                 fprintf(stderr,
02774                         "Can't find env LST_SESSION or value is not valid\n");
02775                 return -1;
02776         }
02777 
02778         while (1) {
02779                 c = getopt_long(argc, argv, "o:d:c:t:saiel",
02780                                 query_batch_opts, &optidx);
02781 
02782                 /* Detect the end of the options. */
02783                 if (c == -1)
02784                         break;
02785 
02786                 switch (c) {
02787                 case 'o':
02788                         timeout = atoi(optarg);
02789                         break;
02790                 case 'd':
02791                         delay = atoi(optarg);
02792                         break;
02793                 case 'c':
02794                         loop = atoi(optarg);
02795                         break;
02796                 case 't':
02797                         test = atoi(optarg);
02798                         break;
02799                 case 's':
02800                         server = 1;
02801                         break;
02802                 case 'a':
02803                         active = verbose = 1;
02804                         break;
02805                 case 'i':
02806                         idle = verbose = 1;
02807                         break;
02808                 case 'e':
02809                         error = verbose = 1;
02810                         break;
02811                 case 'l':
02812                         verbose = 1;
02813                         break;
02814                 default:
02815                         lst_print_usage(argv[0]);
02816                         return -1;
02817                 }
02818         }
02819 
02820         if (test < 0 || timeout <= 0 || delay <= 0 || loop <= 0) {
02821                 lst_print_usage(argv[0]);
02822                 return -1;
02823         }
02824 
02825         if (optind == argc) {
02826                 batch = LST_DEFAULT_BATCH;
02827 
02828         } else if (optind == argc - 1) {
02829                 batch = argv[optind];
02830 
02831         } else {
02832                 lst_print_usage(argv[0]);
02833                 return -1;
02834         }
02835 
02836 
02837         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&head);
02838 
02839         if (verbose) {
02840                 rc = lst_info_batch_ioctl(batch, test, server,
02841                                           &ent, NULL, NULL, NULL);
02842                 if (rc != 0) {
02843                         fprintf(stderr, "Failed to query %s [%d]: %s\n",
02844                                 batch, test, strerror(errno));
02845                         return -1;
02846                 }
02847 
02848                 count = server ? ent.tbe_srv_nle.nle_nnode :
02849                                  ent.tbe_cli_nle.nle_nnode;
02850                 if (count == 0) {
02851                         fprintf(stdout, "Batch or test is empty\n");
02852                         return 0;
02853                 }
02854         }
02855 
02856         rc = lst_alloc_rpcent(&head, count, 0);
02857         if (rc != 0) {
02858                 fprintf(stderr, "Out of memory\n");
02859                 return rc;
02860         }
02861 
02862         for (i = 0; i < loop; i++) {
02863                 time_t  now = time(NULL);
02864 
02865                 if (now - last < delay) {
02866                         sleep(delay - now + last);
02867                         time(&now);
02868                 }
02869 
02870                 last = now;
02871 
02872                 rc = lst_query_batch_ioctl(batch, test,
02873                                            server, timeout, &head);
02874                 if (rc == -1) {
02875                         fprintf(stderr, "Failed to query batch: %s\n",
02876                                 strerror(errno));
02877                         break;
02878                 }
02879 
02880                 if (verbose) {
02881                         /* Verbose mode */
02882                         lst_print_tsb_verbose(&head, active, idle, error);
02883                         continue;
02884                 }
02885 
02886                 fprintf(stdout, "%s [%d] ", batch, test);
02887 
02888                 if (lstcon_rpc_stat_failure(&trans_stat, 0) != 0) {
02889                         fprintf(stdout, "%d of %d nodes are unknown, ",
02890                                 lstcon_rpc_stat_failure(&trans_stat, 0),
02891                                 lstcon_rpc_stat_total(&trans_stat, 0));
02892                 }
02893 
02894                 if (lstcon_rpc_stat_failure(&trans_stat, 0) == 0 &&
02895                     lstcon_tsbqry_stat_run(&trans_stat, 0)  == 0  &&
02896                     lstcon_tsbqry_stat_failure(&trans_stat, 0) == 0) {
02897                         fprintf(stdout, "is stopped\n");
02898                         continue;
02899                 }
02900 
02901                 if (lstcon_rpc_stat_failure(&trans_stat, 0) == 0 &&
02902                     lstcon_tsbqry_stat_idle(&trans_stat, 0) == 0 &&
02903                     lstcon_tsbqry_stat_failure(&trans_stat, 0) == 0) {
02904                         fprintf(stdout, "is running\n");
02905                         continue;
02906                 }
02907 
02908                 fprintf(stdout, "stopped: %d , running: %d, failed: %d\n",
02909                                 lstcon_tsbqry_stat_idle(&trans_stat, 0),
02910                                 lstcon_tsbqry_stat_run(&trans_stat, 0),
02911                                 lstcon_tsbqry_stat_failure(&trans_stat, 0));
02912         }
02913 
02914         lst_free_rpcent(&head);
02915 
02916         return rc;
02917 }
02918 
02919 int
02920 lst_parse_distribute(char *dstr, int *dist, int *span)
02921 {
02922         *dist = atoi(dstr);
02923         if (*dist <= 0)
02924                 return -1;
02925 
02926         dstr = strchr(dstr, ':');
02927         if (dstr == NULL)
02928                 return -1;
02929 
02930         *span = atoi(dstr + 1);
02931         if (*span <= 0)
02932                 return -1;
02933 
02934         return 0;
02935 }
02936 
02937 int
02938 lst_get_bulk_param(int argc, char **argv, lst_test_bulk_param_t *bulk)
02939 {
02940         char   *tok = NULL;
02941         char   *end = NULL;
02942         int     rc  = 0;
02943         int     i   = 0;
02944 
02945         bulk->blk_size  = 4096;
02946         bulk->blk_opc   = LST_BRW_READ;
02947         bulk->blk_flags = LST_BRW_CHECK_NONE;
02948 
02949         while (i < argc) {
02950                 if (strcasestr(argv[i], "check=") == argv[i] ||
02951                     strcasestr(argv[i], "c=") == argv[i]) {
02952                         tok = strchr(argv[i], '=') + 1;
02953 
02954                         if (strcasecmp(tok, "full") == 0) {
02955                                 bulk->blk_flags = LST_BRW_CHECK_FULL;
02956                         } else if (strcasecmp(tok, "simple") == 0) {
02957                                 bulk->blk_flags = LST_BRW_CHECK_SIMPLE;
02958                         } else {
02959                                 fprintf(stderr, "Unknow flag %s\n", tok);
02960                                 return -1;
02961                         }
02962 
02963                 } else if (strcasestr(argv[i], "size=") == argv[i] ||
02964                            strcasestr(argv[i], "s=") == argv[i]) {
02965                         int max_size = sysconf(_SC_PAGESIZE) * LNET_MAX_IOV;
02966 
02967                         tok = strchr(argv[i], '=') + 1;
02968 
02969                         bulk->blk_size = strtol(tok, &end, 0);
02970                         if (bulk->blk_size <= 0) {
02971                                 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid size %s\n", tok);
02972                                 return -1;
02973                         }
02974 
02975                         if (end == NULL)
02976                                 return 0;
02977 
02978                         if (*end == 'k' || *end == 'K')
02979                                 bulk->blk_size *= 1024;
02980                         else if (*end == 'm' || *end == 'M')
02981                                 bulk->blk_size *= 1024 * 1024;
02982 
02983                         if (bulk->blk_size > max_size) {
02984                                 fprintf(stderr, "Size exceed limitation: %d bytes\n",
02985                                         bulk->blk_size);
02986                                 return -1;
02987                         }
02988 
02989                 } else if (strcasecmp(argv[i], "read") == 0 ||
02990                            strcasecmp(argv[i], "r") == 0) {
02991                         bulk->blk_opc = LST_BRW_READ;
02992 
02993                 } else if (strcasecmp(argv[i], "write") == 0 ||
02994                            strcasecmp(argv[i], "w") == 0) {
02995                         bulk->blk_opc = LST_BRW_WRITE;
02996 
02997                 } else {
02998                         fprintf(stderr, "Unknow parameter: %s\n", argv[i]);
02999                         return -1;
03000                 }
03001 
03002                 i++;
03003         }
03004 
03005         return rc;
03006 }
03007 
03008 int
03009 lst_get_test_param(char *test, int argc, char **argv, void **param, int *plen)
03010 {
03011         lst_test_bulk_param_t *bulk = NULL;
03012         int                    type;
03013 
03014         type = lst_test_name2type(test);
03015         if (type < 0) {
03016                 fprintf(stderr, "Unknow test name %s\n", test);
03017                 return -1;
03018         }
03019 
03020         switch (type) {
03021         case LST_TEST_PING:
03022                 break;
03023 
03024         case LST_TEST_BULK:
03025                 bulk = malloc(sizeof(*bulk));
03026                 if (bulk == NULL) {
03027                         fprintf(stderr, "Out of memory\n");
03028                         return -1;
03029                 }
03030 
03031                 memset(bulk, 0, sizeof(*bulk));
03032 
03033                 if (lst_get_bulk_param(argc, argv, bulk) != 0) {
03034                         free(bulk);
03035                         return -1;
03036                 }
03037 
03038                 *param = bulk;
03039                 *plen  = sizeof(*bulk);
03040 
03041                 break;
03042 
03043         default:
03044                 break;
03045         }
03046 
03047         /* TODO: parse more parameter */
03048         return type;
03049 }
03050 
03051 int
03052 lst_add_test_ioctl(char *batch, int type, int loop, int concur,
03053                    int dist, int span, char *sgrp, char *dgrp,
03054                    void *param, int plen, int *retp, struct list_head *resultp)
03055 {
03056         lstio_test_args_t args = {0};
03057 
03058         args.lstio_tes_key        = session_key;
03059         args.lstio_tes_bat_nmlen  = strlen(batch);
03060         args.lstio_tes_bat_name   = batch;
03061         args.lstio_tes_type       = type;
03062         args.lstio_tes_oneside    = 0;
03063         args.lstio_tes_loop       = loop;
03064         args.lstio_tes_concur     = concur;
03065         args.lstio_tes_dist       = dist;
03066         args.lstio_tes_span       = span;
03067         args.lstio_tes_sgrp_nmlen = strlen(sgrp);
03068         args.lstio_tes_sgrp_name  = sgrp;
03069         args.lstio_tes_dgrp_nmlen = strlen(dgrp);
03070         args.lstio_tes_dgrp_name  = dgrp;
03071         args.lstio_tes_param_len  = plen;
03072         args.lstio_tes_param      = param;
03073         args.lstio_tes_retp       = retp;
03074         args.lstio_tes_resultp    = resultp;
03075 
03076         return lst_ioctl(LSTIO_TEST_ADD, &args, sizeof(args));
03077 }
03078 
03079 int
03080 jt_lst_add_test(int argc, char **argv)
03081 {
03082         struct list_head    head;
03083         char         *batch  = NULL;
03084         char         *test   = NULL;
03085         char         *dstr   = NULL;
03086         char         *from   = NULL;
03087         char         *to     = NULL;
03088         void         *param  = NULL;
03089         int           optidx = 0;
03090         int           concur = 1;
03091         int           loop   = -1;
03092         int           dist   = 1;
03093         int           span   = 1;
03094         int           plen   = 0;
03095         int           fcount = 0;
03096         int           tcount = 0;
03097         int           ret    = 0;
03098         int           type;
03099         int           rc;
03100         int           c;
03101 
03102         static struct option add_test_opts[] =
03103         {
03104                 {"batch",       required_argument, 0, 'b' },
03105                 {"concurrency", required_argument, 0, 'c' },
03106                 {"distribute",  required_argument, 0, 'd' },
03107                 {"from",        required_argument, 0, 'f' },
03108                 {"to",          required_argument, 0, 't' },
03109                 {"loop",        required_argument, 0, 'l' },
03110                 {0,             0,                 0,  0  }
03111         };
03112 
03113         if (session_key == 0) {
03114                 fprintf(stderr,
03115                         "Can't find env LST_SESSION or value is not valid\n");
03116                 return -1;
03117         }
03118 
03119         while (1) {
03120                 c = getopt_long(argc, argv, "b:c:d:f:l:t:",
03121                                 add_test_opts, &optidx);
03122 
03123                 /* Detect the end of the options. */
03124                 if (c == -1)
03125                         break;
03126 
03127                 switch (c) {
03128                 case 'b':
03129                         batch = optarg;
03130                         break;
03131                 case 'c':
03132                         concur = atoi(optarg);
03133                         break;
03134                 case 'd':
03135                         dstr = optarg;
03136                         break;
03137                 case 'f':
03138                         from = optarg;
03139                         break;
03140                 case 'l':
03141                         loop = atoi(optarg);
03142                         break;
03143                 case 't':
03144                         to = optarg;
03145                         break;
03146                 default:
03147                         lst_print_usage(argv[0]);
03148                         return -1;
03149                 }
03150         }
03151 
03152         if (optind == argc || from == NULL || to == NULL) {
03153                 lst_print_usage(argv[0]);
03154                 return -1;
03155         }
03156 
03157         if (concur <= 0 || concur > LST_MAX_CONCUR) {
03158                 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid concurrency of test: %d\n", concur);
03159                 return -1;
03160         }
03161 
03162         if (batch == NULL)
03163                 batch = LST_DEFAULT_BATCH;
03164 
03165         if (dstr != NULL) {
03166                 rc = lst_parse_distribute(dstr, &dist, &span);
03167                 if (rc != 0) {
03168                         fprintf(stderr, "Invalid distribution: %s\n", dstr);
03169                         return -1;
03170                 }
03171         }
03172 
03173         test = argv[optind++];
03174 
03175         argc -= optind;
03176         argv += optind;
03177 
03178         type = lst_get_test_param(test, argc, argv, &param, &plen);
03179         if (type < 0) {
03180                 fprintf(stderr, "Failed to add test (%s)\n", test);
03181                 return -1;
03182         }
03183 
03184         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&head);
03185 
03186         rc = lst_get_node_count(LST_OPC_GROUP, from, &fcount, NULL);
03187         if (rc != 0) {
03188                 fprintf(stderr, "Can't get count of nodes from %s: %s\n",
03189                         from, strerror(errno));
03190                 goto out;
03191         }
03192 
03193         rc = lst_get_node_count(LST_OPC_GROUP, to, &tcount, NULL);
03194         if (rc != 0) {
03195                 fprintf(stderr, "Can't get count of nodes from %s: %s\n",
03196                         to, strerror(errno));
03197                 goto out;
03198         }
03199 
03200         rc = lst_alloc_rpcent(&head, fcount > tcount ? fcount : tcount, 0);
03201         if (rc != 0) {
03202                 fprintf(stderr, "Out of memory\n");
03203                 goto out;
03204         }
03205 
03206         rc = lst_add_test_ioctl(batch, type, loop, concur,
03207                                 dist, span, from, to, param, plen, &ret, &head);
03208 
03209         if (rc == 0) {
03210                 fprintf(stdout, "Test was added successfully\n");
03211                 if (ret != 0) {
03212                         fprintf(stdout, "Server group contains userland test "
03213                                 "nodes, old version of tcplnd can't accept "
03214                                 "connection request\n");
03215                 }
03216 
03217                 goto out;
03218         }
03219 
03220         if (rc == -1) {
03221                 lst_print_error("test", "Failed to add test: %s\n",
03222                                 strerror(errno));
03223                 goto out;
03224         }
03225 
03226         lst_print_transerr(&head, "add test");
03227 out:
03228         lst_free_rpcent(&head);
03229 
03230         if (param != NULL)
03231                 free(param);
03232 
03233         return rc;
03234 }

03269          "Usage: lst add_test [--batch BATCH] [--loop #] [--concurrency #] "
03270          " [--distribute #:#] [--from GROUP] [--to GROUP] TEST..."                      },
03271         {"help",                Parser_help,            0,     "help"                   },
03272         {0,                     0,                      0,      NULL                    }
03273 };
03274 
03275 int
03276 lst_initialize(void)
03277 {
03278         char   *key;
03279         char   *feats;
03280 
03281         feats = getenv("LST_FEATURES");
03282         if (feats != NULL)
03283                 session_features = strtol(feats, NULL, 16);
03284 
03285         if ((session_features & ~LST_FEATS_MASK) != 0) {
03286                 fprintf(stderr,
03287                         "Unsupported session features %x, "
03288                         "only support these features so far: %x\n",
03289                         (session_features & ~LST_FEATS_MASK), LST_FEATS_MASK);
03290                 return -1;
03291         }
03292 
03293         key = getenv("LST_SESSION");
03294 
03295         if (key == NULL) {
03296                 session_key = 0;
03297                 return 0;
03298         }
03299 
03300         session_key = atoi(key);
03301 
03302         return 0;
03303 }
03304 
03305 int
03306 main(int argc, char **argv)
03307 {
03308         int rc = 0;
03309 
03310         setlinebuf(stdout);
03311 
03312         rc = lst_initialize();
03313         if (rc < 0)
03314                 goto errorout;
03315 
03316         rc = ptl_initialize(argc, argv);
03317         if (rc < 0)
03318                 goto errorout;
03319 
03320         Parser_init("lst > ", lst_cmdlist);
03321 
03322         if (argc != 1)  {
03323                 rc = Parser_execarg(argc - 1, argv + 1, lst_cmdlist);
03324                 goto errorout;
03325         }
03326 
03327         Parser_commands();
03328 
03329 errorout:
03330         return rc;
03331 }
